name: Happy home in heart of Brunswick!
summary: Unknown
space: Fantastic, modern two storey townhouse with garden in Brunswick’s best neighbourhood. The ground floor comprises an open plan kitchen and living area with a downstairs toilet. Upstairs there are two comfortable bedrooms, one with city views and the other overlooking our lovely courtyard garden.  Both bedrooms have a queen size bed.  The bathroom and a separate toilet is also located upstairs. The property is fully furnished, clean and comfortable and has all you need for an enjoyable stay in wonderful inner Melbourne.  It is our family home (when we’re not away!) and we’re sure you will love it as much as we do.
host_about:
Hi!  We're a mid-30s Australian/British couple (Helen is English and Jamie is Australian) and have been living in our wonderful inner-city Brunswick property for the last 7 years.  We are big nature lovers and like to get out into the great outdoors as often as we can.  We're also big travellers and - before our little one year old son arrived - have been lucky to spend a lot of time wandering around overseas, during which time we first started using Air bnb.  Now, when we're away, we like to offer our great little place in Melbourne to fellow travellers and visitors so they can enjoy a wonderful stay!  

We're friendly, respectful and passionate about minimising our impact on our beautiful planet!  Please don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions :)

name: Spacious apartment walking distance to everything

It's too hard to decide – just let us know what you think after your perfect Melbourne vacation.

name: Collingwood StayCentral Silos 7 near Richmond
summary: This extra large stunner is located amongst so many cafes, restaurants, shops & near the trains and trams. It has magnificent, commanding views from high-up in the Islington Silos; well and truly overlooking all nearby buildings. The stunning 7th floor views are constantly changing; from gorgeous sunrises and early morning balloons floating by, to wonderful nighttime views of the CBD. It has easterly city views towards the Dandenong ranges, and other views towards the MCG and Eureka Tower.
space: With more than 550 reviews for StayCentral on Tripadvisor, Airbnb & (Hidden by Airbnb) , at 4.9 Stars, why look elsewhere? FEATURES: Fully furnished 1 king bed and 2 queen 2 bathrooms including a separate toilet Extra single bed (foldaway) available for a small fee Full, huge kitchen with cutlery, crockery, 30L microwave, oven, dishwasher and plenty of storage Balcony with amazing urban views from the seventh floor Coffee Machine 24/7 check-in service* with full induction of apartment and building facilities Washing Machine  Clothes dryer Unlimited Wi-Fi Large 55” UHD TV (with free Netflix) Small gym at bottom of elevator Security undercover parking for 2 cars We sanitise beds, carpets & soft furnishings on a regular basis RATE INCLUSIONS: Spacious apartment of approximately 130 m2 Utilities (water, electricity, gas, internet & Netflix) All linen and towels Port-a-cot and high chair available on request for a small fee Interim cleaning for stays longer than 14 nights Security, reserved
host_about:
A mining engineer by profession, I have owned two other service businesses since 1998. I started StayCentral when I purchased one apartment in 2005, and now manage multiple properties in many different locations in inner Melbourne.

Like many of my guests, I love to travel; both overseas on epic journeys (including remote locations like the Mulu Caves in Borneo, ancient cities (in Nepal, Turkey, Peru & Jordan), Antarctica & Alaska, Torres del Paine and colourful markets in amazing places like Fa Long in Vietnam, Jaisalmer in India, & La Paz in Bolivia). I also love short domestic trips for weekends away just to relax. It means I get to be on the other side of the counter, and experience how other people look after their guests: and I take their good ideas back with me. 

(My manager, Max, has also travelled from afar to be here btw, and he can also speak with our guests in Russian and Ukranian).

I even worked as a part-time tourist guide in Melbourne for a couple of years, and really enjoyed the interactions with the tourists off the huge cruise liners that appear in Melbourne each spring and summer. I have tried to extend this experience into my accommodation business here at home, where I really love assisting people with their stays. You only need to read the 550 or so reviews on Airbnb, Trip advisor, Goo gle, and on my own StayCentral website to realise how much our guests enjoy our apartments, and the way we look after them. 

I like keeping fit with gym work and roller-blading; often blading 30 kms or so on a day out. I cook for my mates once a month, and have done so since 2007. I cook and they bring the wine; my other love since coming to Melbourne in 2003.

I love living in Melbourne. It enjoys a unique place in Australia. It is often described as the cultural, business, shopping and sporting capital of the country. The restaurants and cafes in Melbourne are amongst the best in the world. I love living in an urban village amongst these, and all the other everyday shops; and jumping on a tram and avoiding the hassles of traffic. It is a city of great opportunity, experiences, events and lifestyle that can be enjoyed by locals and visitors alike; and I really enjoy facilitating our guests' stays here.

StayCentral Melbourne Corporate Apartments is a unique group of serviced apartments in central Melbourne. We offer boutique short and long-stay accommodation for relocations, family holidays and getaways. Our comfortable apartments have also been enjoyed by employees and contractors, executives and people needing temporary accommodation. We even have many pet-friendly apartments available! We provide excellent customer service from the time you first contact us to make a booking, through to the end of your stay.

All of our properties from one-bedroom apartments to seven-bedroom mansions are close to all the everyday things our guests would need during their stay; from cafes, restaurants and supermarkets, to shops, trams and nightlife - yet all locations are generally very quiet.

All of our interiors have been designed by experienced interior designers, and you will experience that feeling of "I'm home!" when you walk in, make yourself a cuppa and put your feet up. We supply far more than tea and coffee etc. There are many extras that make your stay more pleasant for our guests; including shopping trolleys, free Netflix in most properties, umbrellas and book exchanges.

I do hope I have the opportunity to help you get to know Melbourne and grow to love it as I have.

name: Architect's Abode
summary: In Melbourne’s most sought-after Paris End of the city, there stands the most famous thinnest state of the art residential building known as Phoenix Tower designed by Fender Katsalidis Architects. For a short time I am listing one of two bedrooms and you are more than welcome to stay and enjoy this most exclusive residence.
space: The apartment takes the whole floor and comprises open plan living and dining, large kitchen with marble bench tops and high-end Smeg, Liebherr, Vintec, and Miele appliances, Artemide lighting, direct lift access, high concrete ceilings, timber floors, air-conditioning and heating system, Bose sound system, large flat screen TV and a secure surveillance intercom system.
host_about: I am a German Australian architect, writer and practice owner. I studied at the renown Architectural Association in London, have had work exhibited at the Victoria and Albert and worked with notable designers in Europe, Malaysia and Australia. Im well traveled, open minded, highly accommodating person. I really like philosophy, different cultures, visiting galleries, eating well and meeting new people. I very familiar with Melbourne and like to show guests around when I'm free. I look forward to welcoming you here and making your stay as comfortable as possible.

name: Executive Apartment with Stunning River Views
summary: My place is in walking distance from Federation Square, MoVida, Hosier Lane, MCG, Rod Laver Arena, Flinders Street Station etc... You’ll love my place because of the ambiance, the neighbourhood, and the comfy bed. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids). Enjoy Melbourne's 'Laneway Culture' in this newly built apartment in the heart of city, close to MCG and among some of the city's finest restaurants, bars and cafes.
space: Everything you'd expect from a Melbourne city apartment and more! Sleeping up to 3 guests with a queen bed and a single bed. The apartment is equipped with unlimited wi-fi and smart TV. The kitchen has ample cooking facilities and a dishwasher, all towels and bedding are provided. Shopping is so close by - you can walk the new Emporium Shopping Centre (300 shops approx.), Melbourne Central Shopping Complex, Myer or David Jones our local Department Stores and H&M. Melbourne is definitely the shopping capital of Australia. The historical Queen Victoria Market selling a huge range of fresh food, clothing and touristy gifts is close from property as well.  Car parking can be organised with additional charge and is subject to availability.
host_about:
Hello,

Melbourne is one of my favourite cities of the world and my apartment is a great place to stay for you to enjoy what this beautiful city has to offer- with its convenient location, clean and nicely decorated apartment. I am quite flexible, easygoing and also respecful of people's privacy, which means you can book with complete confidence and stress free stay for your visit.  

I really enjoy meeting new people and I look forward to welcome you to my place in Melbourne.

name: Queen Bed, Uniquely large apartment.
summary: This very spacious, light-filled apartment is central to some of Melbourne's best! Less than 5km from the City and surrounded by some of the most popular streets for shopping, art, cafes, environment and restaurants!
space: While only I live in this apartment, my partner will sometimes be around as well. This home is a bright and spacious open plan apartment in a leafy block of secured entrance apartments.  We arguably live in one of the best locations for exploring the coolest parts of Melbourne. Not only are we less than 5 km from the heart of the City, we are surrounded by some of the most popular streets for shopping, art, cafes and restaurants. Popular Brunswick St, Smith St, Lygon St, Sydney Rd and Gertrude St, Melbourne Museum, Carlton Gardens, Edinburgh Gardens, are all close by, easily accessed on foot, car, tram or bus. There is a tram stop (96) right outside the property's back door. However our first floor apartment means we are removed from street bustle creating a peaceful and quiet space to enjoy.  The apartment is light filled and open with many large windows. We often enjoy vibrant sunsets and the view of the city. Your private room has a proper bed frame and two supportive contoured foam

name: The North Fitzroy Stables
summary: A uniquely Melbourne experience - perfect for an extended (or short) stay.  The Stables were originally built in 1880 for the horses that serviced the Victorian home they are situated behind (where we live).  The Stables have been converted into sun-lit, private, fully self-contained accommodation over 2 levels with a shared garden and independent access (allowing you to come and go as you please).  It is a short stroll to great food, leafy Edinburgh Gardens, public transport and bike paths.
space: Essentially a small, stand alone, tastefully decorated home (with kitchen).  The Stables are fully heated and air-conditioned and provide great accommodation for 1 to 2 people for a short or extended stay. The Stables are approximately 60 sq.m in size over two levels.  The ground floor area has a full kitchen (mini fridge, gas stove & microwave) and an adjoining living area with HDTV, DVD player, Foxtel (cable TV), WiFi, coffee table, couch and desk. Upstairs is a large bedroom with air-conditioning, great natural light, queen size bed (with quality linen, pillows, quilt & electric blanket) also bed side tables & lamps, alarm clock, second TV, chest of drawers and hanging space.  The bathroom with shower & vanity is located off the bedroom on the 1st level.  Please note, the toilet is located on the ground level as a powder room.  The Stables are located in a peaceful street and not in a noisy apartment block with 30 other neighbours.  There is plenty of unrestricted car parking right
host_about:
We are friendly and experienced hosts and travellers.

We enjoy meeting others as well as providing hassle free, well equipped space.  We love coffee, food, the local lifestyle and living where we do and we play an active role in our community. 

We live on the same property as the Stables (in a separate house) and are happy to assist and make your stay as hassle free and comfortable as possible.

We look forward to welcoming you to our part of the world and giving you some great tips on Melbourne.

name: Comfy & quiet single + bathroom, lounge & dining
summary: My home is a 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom house in a terrific location for visitors to Melbourne or business travellers. This listing is a single bedroom (very comfy bed & quiet location) with separate bathroom, lounge & dining area for your exclusive use. Short walk to Alamein station (7 mins) & Ashburton shops, bus ride to Chadstone Shopping Centre, 25 minute train ride to city.  Fabulous walking tracks & bike path. I also have a double bedroom available on request. Happy to answer any questions.
space: This bedroom is completely private (at one end of the house) with exclusive use of your own modern bathroom right next to the bedroom with both a full size bath and separate shower (towels, shampoo, bubble bath and soap supplied).  The bed is really comfy and has both blankets and a doona (all bed linen supplied).  I have a selection of different pillows for all tastes.  There is plenty of cupboard space (and plenty of hangers!) and the room is bright and very cosy.  I have a double bedroom right next to the single room and this is available for an additional cost (let me know if you would like to consider this option).   Please note that you will be the only guests in my home when you make a booking, I don't have multiple different guest bookings at the one time.
host_about: Hi, my name is Virginia and being an Airbnb host is a wonderful experience.  I have lived most of my life in Melbourne and love this city, even the changeable weather!  I am a passionate gardener, love cooking and I have been fortunate to be able to travel to many parts of the world.  Before the Airbnb platform was developed I had stayed in many houses whilst travelling in Europe - it just used to be called staying in other people’s houses back then!!  I am outgoing, enjoy the company of others, love meeting new people and have a great sense of humour.  I have a great house which I love and I am sure you will too.  It would be great to hear from you if you have any questions.
