space: Everything that we have done in the house is out of pure love and joy for the space. Everything was purchased and made because we loved it so much. Our guests will experience the pleasure and comfort through out their stay. We live near the city for work, so we have chosen Valley Ranges Getaways as our hosts to look after your requirements as they are local, so very happy to speak with you at any time.  (URL HIDDEN) (URL HIDDEN)
host_about:
We are a young family with 2 kids a boy 12 and a girl 9.  We have a very busy work/family schedule with a strong emphasis on family values. Both of us work, I am the owner/director at 11 Dimensions p/l an architectural practice, my partner is a business owner of an organic food distribution company HappyGreen. Our goal is to maintain connection with nature on regular basis to recharge and re-connect. We love adventures and travel, great food, anything to do with design, environment protection, happy life, connection with friends and family. My personal passions are travel photography and my kids, animals and nature, dance, music, art and theatre, green architecture and natural parenting.
We have both travelled around the world extensively over the years as backpackers and as a family with kids. Covered South America, North America, Europe, Asia and Eastern Europe. And we have plans to see a lot more. On our travels we have met many wonderful people from all over the world, their generosity and kindness is still in our hearts.

Start your morning with a coffee from the famous Friends of Mine cafe (just across the road), wander along the Yarra to get to a funky Abbotsford cafe or head straight to the MCG.  You’ll have access to two spacious bedrooms, an open-plan kitchen/living/dining area, one bathroom and a gorgeous backyard which is the perfect place to relax.
space: House Overview: - Newly renovated - 2 bedrooms & a reading nook - 1 bathroom  - Fully-equipped kitchen - Open living/dining space - Private outdoor area Amenities: - Professionally cleaned - Hotel-quality high thread-count bed linen and towels - 24/7 check-in - Private backyard - WiFi Living Room: - Fantastic open-plan space - Relaxing living area with comfy furniture Kitchen: - Fully-equipped - Oven - Stove - Fridge - Dishwasher Master Bedroom: - Queen-sized bed Bedroom 2: - 2 single beds

The tram is located at the end of the street, and you will also have access to your own off street secure carpark. space: *My apartment has brand new wooden flooring so it may appear different to the photos. But different in a completely awesome way!! They’re absolutely gorgeous.  This safe and secure sun filled modern apartment is located on the second floor and can accomodate up to 2 guests, perfect for solo travellers, friends as well as couples. Free Wi-Fi  and Netflix.  A cosy living room with dining table and a fully equipped kitchen.  The bedroom has a king size pillow top bed, pillows and fresh bed linen. Private and secure car park with direct access to the apartment. The bathroom with shower, WC, towels, toilet paper, and lush toiletries all supplied.  The euro laundry has both a washer and a dryer. host_about: I'm an easygoing, happy adventurer.  I've spent years travelling the world and now happily call Melbourne my home.  I love to explore and try new things, whether its food, adventure sports, a new language or a new hobby.  I keep very active and love to box, head to the beach and hike.  Cooking and food in general is a passion, as is photography, wine, dinner parties and I'm quite partial to cats :)  I've used AirBnB as a guest for years as well as CouchSurfed whilst travelling, now its my turn to return the hospitality and show visitors to Melbourne a wonderful time - and to provide a beautiful base from which to explore.

host_about:
Hi Everyone,
I would like give you $55 credit, if you book the apartment from us.
please use my link to create the new account, and book it. 
http://www.airbnb.com.au/c/kent177

I have 29 listings in airbnb, We have different variety of apartments, such as 
1 bedroom 1 bathroom apartments,
2 bedroom 1 bathroom apartments,
2 bedroom 2 bathroom apartments
3 bedroom 2 bathroom apartments

You can enter the date and number of guests from the airbnb listing page, then it will show up which one is available for you.




Being a Airbnb host for 5-6 years. I love being a host, because I know that when people, different group of people and family come to our place, when they feel, it is worth it. I love it and enjoy. That's the happiness that other job may not able to find it. I really love to see when my guests they start to step to the apartment and feel wow and impressed.
Honestly, being a host, it is not easy decision.
We have to make sure every details things in our place are the best to our guests. 
From check-in to check-out. It is an experience not only for guests. it is for us as well. It is the whole responsibilities. 

That’s what I think, the reason which motivates me to be a host.

Melbourne is a very multi-cultural city 
My objective is, if someone come here they should be connected to the right place.
Me, as a host, I think is kind of connecting these different piece together, a kind of connection.
The high point of my stay was how you made me feel. And how you made me feel, it sticks. It sticks with you.”
I have the traditional way to believe.
We believe it is the relationship that provide to the guests they will enjoy,  love the place to stay.
They trust me and I trust them. And that’s the reason it works.
So hospitalities if you ask me, is about care. It s about welcoming. This is about welcoming with open heart.  Welcome you to my Melbourne Apartment.

Please be aware, the wardrobes, shelves, fridge/freezer etc will not be empty but we can always make plenty of space for your things depending on what you need.  Please feel free to use anything from our pantry (and replace if appropriate!) If you have kids, we have lots of toys, books, a Springfree Trampoline, and basketball hoop, bikes, and kids DVDs which you are welcome to use. Master bedroom with ensuite  Downstairs guest bedroom with queen size bed Downstairs bedroom with 2 king single beds with trundle. Upstairs bedroom is massive with 2 king single trundle beds and a queen size bed Our home is your home. We hope you will enjoy it as much as we do.
host_about: Tiffany - mother of 4 children. Loves to travel!

name: Big Room in Quiet, Accessible Area
summary: Our flat has a bedroom that is perfect for an individual or a couple. It comfortably fits 2, has heating and air conditioning and offers great access to public transportation. We are less than 5 min from a 24hour supermarket and numerous restaurants.
space: We have a spare room that comfortably fits 2 people. The room has a double bed, air conditioning, heat and a large closet space. The flat has a small back yard, a kitchen and living area.
host_about:
I am a young male originally from New York who moved to Australia in 2012. I enjoy playing touch rugby, cycling, watching tv, cooking and eating and animals. I have been working in startups since arriving in Australia. 

I live with my girlfriend who is also an entrepreneur. We love meeting new people. We try to cook our own meals most nights and tend to come home around 9pm after a long day.

A great guest would be a friendly outgoing person who enjoys traveling and is adventurous. They can be quiet or loud, but should be respectful of the space and enjoy themselves

Feed ducks/swans
space: No Smoking No Alcohol Door locks Central Heating Central Cooling WIFI Coffee, Tea, Green Tea
host_about: Unknown

name: The Loft
summary: The Loft is located on the top floor of an architecturally designed rammed earth building completely seperate and privately located from the main house and offers comfort with king size bed, quality bed linen, tea and coffee facilities and views of the natural bush below.
space: The Loft has a beautiful relaxing feel, the room is spacious and the tranquil view of the gum trees through the picture window is wonderful. If you are lucky you can watch the Wallabies feed from the room as you can see in the pictures which were taken from the bedroom windows. There is a large amount of bird life in the area from Wedge Tailed Eagles, Black and White Cockatoos, Kookaburras, Rosellas, King Parrots and a vast array of small Finches and Nectar eating birds. There are no cooking facilities but if a weekend away from all that is what you are after there are many great restaurants and takeaway places, or perhaps put a platter together and enjoy with a glass of wine on the deck or in your apartment. Tea and coffee facilities are provided as well as a glass of port on us.
host_about: I grew up living by the beach in Brighton a bayside suburb in Melbourne. I moved to the beautiful Hills town of Cockatoo with my partner, three dogs and a cat four years ago. Our place is a unique mud brick home nestled on sixteen acres of private bush. I love good food, entertaining, decorating and of course animals. When I have time I frequently visit the beach and friends and family who live there. I have three Airbnb properties, two at my home in Cockatoo for those who want to get out of the city and enjoy some peace and quiet and country fresh air, both of are completely separate from each other and the main house so your assured privacy. Then I have a two bedroom apartment in the heart of vibrant St Kilda within walking distance to the beach, restaurants, parks and the cake shops Acland St is famous for. If you need to go into the city it is only a 20 minute tram ride from almost outside your front door.

name: A cosy home
summary: The house is well-equipped with modern facilities. It has easy and convenient access to public transport.
space: This is a renovated house with modern facilities. You will stay with a family of 4 people. The room is clean with a study desk, lamp; it has a cooling and ducted heating throughout. You may share the bathroom and toilet with 2 other people. The house has open space with two living lounges. Therefore you feel comfortable living here. It has a well-maintained garden with lush vegetation. It is located in Springvale South, having easy and convenient access to public transport (5 minutes’ walk to 814, 813 and 902; 3 minutes’ drive to Springvale station).  Shopping is very convenient within the walking distance to Aldi, Mackey shopping centre, Springvale market and Woolworths.
host_about: Unknown

name: very nice single room near railway station
summary: Unknown
space: Unknown

name: MODERN APARTMENT SYDNEY RD
summary: This is a lovely apartment full of natural light, which gains the benefit of the morning sun, while an enclosed balcony houses a BBQ and relaxing dining area looking over amazing views of the city.
space: Come and enjoy great views and city lights from this gorgeous one bedroom apartment located in the heart of Sydney Rd, Brunswick. This is an affordable, tranquil and spacious modern apartment that comes fully furnished with: queen-sized bed, large rooms, freshly painted, fresh carpet, high-speed Wi-Fi,heater, fridge, microwave, kettle, toaster, blender, cutlery.  With Sydney Rd on its doorstep, this newly built home is situated amongst the area’s famous cake shops, where you will find some of Melbourne's best coffee and a truly multi-cultural vibe. Sydney Rd is home to an eclectic mix of cafes, bars, restaurants and shops.  Despite its inner city location, the apartment is fairly quiet, while also benefiting from great transport options. A bike path runs past the front door, and the city's major attractions can easily be reached by tram or train; the apartment is 50 metres away from the No. 19 tram stop and three minutes’ walk from Anstey station.  There is also a supermarket 50 metres
host_about: I am Kevin, french guy who loves traveling for this reason sometimes I rent our apartment during my trips!

If you want go to the city it will take 20minutes. I’m going to travel for 18 days. You will share the común areas with a lovely couple. They start the work early and finish late. name: Gorgeous Terrace House
summary: Immaculately styled home that has just been renovated.  An Abbotsford gem that leaves guests wanting for nothing. This is a great house for a couple but also fantastic for children with the Collingwood children's farm close by.
space: A pretty oasis in the inner city, this delightful Victorian home seamlessly integrates indoor living with a stunning entertainers garden. Restaurants and pubs just a two minutes' walk! A home full of ambience comprising one bedroom with a queen size bed,  2nd bedroom with 2 single beds. kitchen/meals area, lounge (OFP & French doors that open up to the courtyard), bathroom, laundry, high ceilings and a landscaped garden with a gorgeous fig tree. Also a fantastic outdoor shower and bath in the garden!!!  The house is situated in a wonderfully diverse and family-friendly location near a range of cafes and restaurants with trains, trams and buses on your doorstep. Cricket in December and the tennis in Jan are both walking distance, The Abbotsford Convent, Collingwood children's farm, Studley Park, Yarra trails, parkland and the heart of the CBD are all within walking distance. This naturally charming home has been featured in a number of Australian magazines and is one you certainly do no
host_about:
My husband Charlie and I love living in Abbotsford and making this house a home. We have two year old twin daughters and a dog called Gertie.
We enjoy gardening, entertaining and walking the dog. 
If you have any questions or would like to learn any more about us we are always happy to help.

name: 2km from the CBD, Luxury Living
summary: Only 2km from the CBD, this location is perfect for Footy fans, family getaways or travellers alike. Positioned with superb uninterrupted views of City skyline, this stunning luxurious 2bdr apt comes with 1 Queen bed, 2 King Single Beds, 2 separate bathrooms and 5 star amenities to spoil yourselves with!
space: With magnificent views of the CBD, the apartment comprises of a top quality designer kitchen with large living, spacious balcony, two large bedrooms complemented by two bathrooms.  The apartment also comes fully furnished with the following for your convenience: - NBN High Speed Wifi  - 42" LCD TV - Nespresso Coffee Machine - Fridge - Kettle - Microwave - Aircon/ Heating - Washing machine  - Dryer - Dishwasher  - Iron & ironing board - Luxury Towels  - Cooking utensils - Cutlery - Dooner, blankets and pillows - Toilet paper
host_about:
Stay With Style are a Melbourne team who offer individual quality accommodation in popular inner city areas of Melbourne . Our properties are carefully selected , most managed on behalf of our landlords and some which are our own.  Feel free to inquire for longer stays - we love a good deal!

If it is not us who check you in, it will be our very helpful cleaners/housekeepers who will provide you with just as much information as we would.

If you have a property we will be happy to look after that too. 

Happy travelling!

name: THE LODGE - COLONIAL LUXURY IN FITZROY NORTH
summary: 126sq meter 2 bedroom first floor flat with 20sq meter terrace above Argo Fishop's  Eatery in N. Fitzroy with its own private entrance.  Includes dining room, lounge, kitchen, study and laundry. New split heating and cooling system installed throughout. Decorated to a very high standard in colonial style with antique furniture including four poster beds, crystal chandeliers and silk curtains. Close to CBD with easy access via tram line 86; stop is at front of property.
space: Access to the flat is via a staircase at rear of the building (private entrance from laneway). Not suitable for young children or for persons with limited mobility. No smoking policy applies to the premises.
host_about: Unknown

name: Cosy Melbourne Retreat - Walk to Everything!
summary: Newly renovated mezzanine apartment inside heritage building  - all to yourself - located in the heart of Melbourne's CBD! Very close to everything from Cafe's, Bars, Restaurants - you name it - all walkable! Very close to famous Hardware Lane and shopping precincts Melbourne Central, Emporium & Bourke St Mall. The SkyBus LINK service will take you from Melbourne Airport right to our door!
space: Sleeps 4 with 1 queen bed and 1 queen fold out sofa-bed. Includes free WiFi and 42 inch full HD TV with HDMI capability. The perfect wind down environment after spending a day out in beautiful Melbourne. Whether you're alone, a couple, 2 couples or a small family - our place is suitable! Electrical appliances include electric stove top, toaster, kettle, iron & hair dryer. Ground floor apartment near front door for easy, quick access any time.
host_about: We are 2 designers born and raised in Melbourne! Maddison is in Communication Design whilst Adrian is working in Toy Design and Development!

name: Amazing modern living in best area

space: Luxurious living room and 2 separate decks with a hammock and outdoor dining table and bbq.
host_about: I enjoy eating and drinking and traveling and spending fun time with interesting people.

summary: Unknown

Start your day with complimentary coffee and tea.
host_about:
Welcome to Serviced Apartments Melbourne - Lighthouse.

We are a Melbourne based company with multiple properties throughout Melbourne's central suburbs!

We aim to offer a home away from home for all of our guest with our homely serviced apartments. 

We hope to welcome you into our home!

- Serviced Apartments Melbourne –

name: House in the Hills (Room 1)
summary: My place is close to: St. Andrews market (every Saturday);  Nillumbik Winery;  Rob Roy Hill Climb;  State Parks; Sugarloaf Reservoir;  St.Andrews pony club;  the Yarra Valley and its wineries;  St. Andrews and Panton Hill Hotels;  a myriad of bike, horse and walking trails.  You’ll love my place because of the outdoors space and the ambiance. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, bike riders, horse riders, wine lovers, star gazers, market goers,bird watchers and nature enthusiasts.
space: Double room with TV and DVD player. Bathroom exclusively for guests.
host_about: Unknown

name: Spacious room in South Yarra artist's haven
summary: A beautiful, spacious and unique room in a rambling artists haven of grand proportions. Surrounded by an established garden, in a quiet and leafy residential area, this home is a short walking distance to trams, trains and the South Yarra/Chapel Street destination shopping precinct. The Yarra river and bike tracks are nearby as is the MCG. Trains run frequently from the South Yarra station to Melbourne's Flinders street train station which is just two stops away.
space: This house is a delight and has it's own quirks which we  love. It is rare to find so many high-quality period features intact, such as light fittings and fireplace surrounds. These are of particular note in the guest room.  With high ceilings plus grand windows and doorways, the house is very spacious and not dark and dim like many older houses. Aside from Internet and gas central heating, not much has been done to this house to bring it into the 21st Century.  The bathroom, for example still has the original deep bathtub, matching hand basin tiles from the early 1900's. A new shower head has been added and we do what we can to keep the bathroom warm and well ventilated, but this is far from a modern bathroom!  If you are seeking a modern, slick bathroom with underfloor heating, large mirror and halogen lighting then you'd be better off looking for another place to stay.  Likewise, the ancient Aga cooker (which, alas, no longer works) in the kitchen still takes pride of place but ther
host_about:
I believe in kindness. Good food is also great! My roots lie in Australia, though spent 17 years living in Europe and India. 

Having recently returned to the Antipodes, I'm re-discovering how much the vitality of the land and the ocean move me. The people are also great too - though wherever I've travelled, I've found there are other great people, and have enjoyed connecting with them.

...There is still so much of the world that I wish to explore, and so many more people that I wish to learn from...

I make art, or think about it.

name: Walk to the Bay
summary: Our Home in Elwood is a 4 min walk to the Bay and a 10 min walk to Acland Street St Kilda.  We have 2 Large Bedrooms and a lovely new kitchen, 2 Bathrooms and a lovely backyard.
space: If possible I would like to meet all guests and show them through our home.
host_about: Hi my name is Rita, I love to travel.  I enjoy reading and sewing. Love going to the movies and going for long walks along the beach. I enjoy entertaining and catching up with friends.

Trams no 12 (13 mins to Swanston street)and 58(takes u to the Queen Victoria Market). South Melbourne market just about 15 mins walking.The room is in level 20 in a luxury building. There are two girls in the second room happy to help you. Lastly, the bed has a small issue as the frame is for queen mattress but we got a double mattress.

name: The Frida House, Heritage Listed Queen BR
summary: Fifth Avenue is a warm renovated Victorian style home close to trams/trains, 15mins from Melbourne CBD and Tullamarine Airport. We have a large kitchen and living area. Also a backyard space with chickens and a fire pit. Incl. little dog Jethro, a short haired cutie that never barks. Please take into consideration the presence of a pet if you have allergies. If you're looking for a comfortable friendly alternative to Melbourne's hostels, hotels or temporary accomodations, we'd love to host you!
space: Our house is comfortable and colourful!  Whether it's relaxing on leather lounges with a tea in the afternoon or enjoying the sun in the garden, it is a welcome home away from home.
host_about:
I am a 28 yr old living in my lovely Brunswick home full of flowers and colour. Making a career for myself as an Arts Therapist, I love to be creative and make new things. My home is my favourite place to be and I like to share it with others. I enjoy creating quirky spaces for people to relax (especially if youve been travelling and are in need of a stress free place to put your feet up)
I love my little dog Jethro and enjoy my backyard chickens, Aggie and Maple. I have enjoyed hosting people from France, Germany, Sweden, China, Brazil, New Zealand, England, Estonia, Ireland, America, and just down the road! Where ever you're coming from I'd be happy to welcome you and make sure you're comfortable for the duration of your stay.

name: Mawarra Manor - Heritage listed mansion and garden
summary: Mawarra is a 3ac luxury estate and is heritage listed. The gardens, designed and constructed by Edna Walling offer numerous "outdoor rooms" whilst the Manor has that wood-panelled old world feel with a country kitchen and amazing avocado-shaped indoor pool with sauna.
space: Mawarra Manor, heritage listed and built in 1932, is set on 3 acres and sleeps 8 in 4 exquisite bedrooms. The garden is recognised as the most famous surviving example by renowned garden designer Edna Walling. Whilst both house and garden have undergone extensive restoration their historic significance has always remained at the forefront of thinking. The manor incorporates all traditional formal and informal rooms that one would expect in a home of this era. Extensive wood panelling, wall to wall carpets, gas central heating, evaporative cooling and tasteful lighting provide a luxurious ambience. The upper level comprises an entry hall, large bow-shaped formal lounge with open fire place, enormous semi-enclosed balcony dining area overlooking the central staircase and garden, country kitchen with Miele appliances including 2 dishwashers, built-in refrigerator and built-in coffee machine, electric oven, gas hob, microwave and separate gas AGA oven and hotplates. The lounge is furnished
host_about: Welcome to Melbourne! We are Melburnians who can give you lots of free advice on sport, theatre, music venues and even who to vote for.

name: Pool, 4 bdrm, 2 bath, 3 min walk to chadstone
summary: This newly renovated, spacious and relaxed family home is conveniently located in the beautiful suburb of East Malvern. Our home has 4 bedrooms, 2 living areas, 2.5 bathrooms, a huge backyard and is central to everything Melbourne has to offer. A new concrete pool has just been completed in September 2018. Our place is close to Chadstone shopping centre (3 min. walk), train stations, buses, restaurants, the cinema, a library, parks, and the M1 freeway.
space: Our home offers the following: There is a tall, secure front fence that can be locked. The house is monitored by a security system externally only. Kitchen: Overlooks the large open plan back living area.  Back living area: Smart tv with Foxtel and Netflix. Large couch and dining table for 8. Bifold doors that completely open up to deck overlooking the pool and backyard. Split system air con. Front living area: Smart tv with Netflix and Xbox. Couch, open fire place and Study nook. Split system air con. Master bedroom: king bed, closet space, Smart tv with Foxtel. Bedroom 2 : Single bed, trundle bed, closet space, desk and PC. Bedroom 3: King single bed, single trundle, closet space, lots of toys. Bedroom 4: Queen bed, drawer space, desk and PC. Bathroom 1: Bath, shower, toilet, vanity with cupboard space. Bathroom 2: Shower, toilet, vanity with cupboard space. Laundry: Washing machine, Dryer, built in ironing board, toilet. New concrete pool with solar heating. Ducted heating throughou
host_about: Family of 5 who love living in Melbourne - the best city in the world.

name: The Marina | Elegant Room | St Kilda/Elwood
summary: Are you looking for Location, Comfort and a Memorable Stay? Then we have a surprise for you!! Staying at with us is like staying with your closest friends who know Melbourne well, and love having guests stay.  A beautifully present room fully equipped with all the mods including a smart TV to entertain you, with all our super fast internet has to offer This cosy Victorian-style room has beautiful character and style. You'll feel very much at home here. Secure your booking with us today...
space: At Little St Kilda we offer AMAZING guest rooms - all of the rooms have luxury hygienic linens, fresh clean towels and mattress and pillow protectors included, reading lights, large windows, modern mini office space, a private fridge, large flat-screen smart TV (connected to NETFLIX and Wifi ) and locked storage space.  We offer a beautifully presented common area - a relaxing lounge and dining space with all the modern amenities.  Here you can truly relax, catch up with people in the house, make yourself a coffee, cook yourself a meal or just grab a local beer or wine. This really is a comfortable space you can call your home away from home.  Frequent travellers ourselves since the 90's and hosts since 2012, we've got a new travel experience for you right here in St Kilda, Melbourne. Book with us to have a memorable stay... This is an experience made just for you.
host_about:
With an eclectic background of many and various jobs such as truck driving, document control, administration, trades assistant and expeditor, one of my longer term positions has been self-employment!

I've currently been involved in the vacation rental and short term accommodation business for more than 10 years and love the direction this industry is taking.  As a self-appointed subject-matter expert, I also mentor and coach others to develop the same success by using short term accommodation to optimise their real estate.  Reach out to me if you need help!

My partner and I are extremely busy and ambitious entrepreneurs with a passion for investing, real estate, property management, renovations, health, wealth, self-development and family. 

We have many projects on the go and are always pushing boundaries outside our comfort zone! 

We love the Airbnb community and being able to offer a unique experience to people visiting Perth, St Kilda and Melbourne.

As frequent travellers ourselves, we enjoy meeting other like-minded folks and it's always fun and interesting to share stories with intrepid travellers just like yourself!

I'm proud to be your Super Host, and with my busy schedule, I split my time between Perth and Melbourne.  

That means you may or may not meet me, but I have developed a super easy self check-in process that all our guests love for the flexibility it offers.

And don't worry; I'm always just a phone call or text message away if ever you need any assistance.

I look forward to ensuring that you have a memorable stay with us!

Safe Travels,
Sahara
Airbnb Superhost, Coach and Mentor

name: Doncaster at Grange
summary: Doncaster Grange Park Accommodation is a fully furnished, 3 bedroom house in a quiet tree lined suburban street. It is suitable for business traveller's, tourists or families as an affordable accommodation option in eastern Melbourne. Grange Park  has a queen bed, 4 single beds, a separate lounge & family room, a fully equipped kitchen, flat screen TV, wireless internet, washing machine & clothes drier, air conditioner in the lounge, bathroom with shower & bath, & a separate toilet. A cot is also available. There is duct heating throughout the house & an air conditioner in the lounge. Grange Park Accommodation is close to the Eastern Freeway and Tram Rd Reserve with its extensive walking tracks.  The library, many restaurants, local shops and Doncaster Shoppingtown are also nearby. Doncaster Secondary College, Box Hill TAFE, Deakin & many of the universities & top of the list private schools in the Eastern suburbs are also easily reached by public transport or car. Grange Park is appro
space: Minimum 2 Night Stay Room Only
host_about: Small family owned business in the Eastern Suburbs of Melbourne.

name: Modern apartment room in centre of Melbourne
summary: Enjoy a comfortable stay in one of my spare rooms in my two bedroom apartment. 5 minute walk to; tram stop, Flagstaff Gardens. 10 minute walk to; Victoria Markets, city centre, Victorian State Library. 20 minute walk to; NGV Gallery, Federation Square. This apartment has security cameras and is very quite to live in. You can also use my bike for riding around the city. Despite not having any WiFi in the house, there are two cafes in walking distance with free Wifi.
space: Secure and very close to the market.
host_about: I enjoy creative jobs, music and spending quality time in nature. A simple life of balanced rest and expressing the soul is what moves me into action.

name: Camberwell Charm - 5 star rating
summary: This fully self contained apartment is a home away from home. Ample living space, with a large fully equipped kitchen, your own laundry, air conditioning and central heating. There is also your own private garden area, separate entrance and permit street parking provided. Public transport is just 5 minutes away. THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL CLEANING FEES FOR THIS PROPERTY.
space: This  apartment has plenty of space. It has a queen size bed in a large bedroom with plenty of cupboards, a full size kitchen, 4 seater dining and large living area. The bathroom has a laundry space with washing machine.  There is a front and back entrance and you have your own outdoor seating area in the garden.
host_about:
We are a couple in our 50s who love to travel and go overseas yearly. When at  home we just enjoy being pottering around the garden and enjoying good food, wine and company. 
Our collection of kids help to keep us young (and exhausted).
We will be helpful and friendly hosts but will also respect your privacy

name: Amazing City Views Apartment
summary: Enjoy a glass of wine while looking at the amazing views of city skyline from your balcony or jump in the roof top spa to get a 360 views of Melbourne, the choice is yours. This apartment is beautifully located on Bray st, just behind the popular chapel st.
space: Its a nice self contained studio apartment. It has a full size fridge, cooking utensils, a washing machine, dryer, microwave a queen bed and a large balcony with best city views. On the top floor there are couple of spas, outdoor decking area, big screen tv etc. for guests to enjoy.
host_about:
I love travelling. I have travelled extensively around the world(India, China, Thailand, Indonesia, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Brazil are a few to name) and also lived in many different cities around the globe. 

While travelling, I always felt that there is dearth of affordable home-like places to stay. So, when I returned back to Melbourne, I decided to bridge the gap. All my apartments are furnished with standard size fridge, washing machine, dryer, microwaves, kitchen and kitchenette etc. to give you a home-like feeling. 
This is my small business which I  run more  from heart than mind. You don't have to look at the watch before contacting me. I will try my best to make sure that you have a  great stay in one of my apartment.

name: Lovely room in Elwood village (2 of 2)
summary: Elwood is one of the best suburbs in Melbourne. Right next to well known St Kilda. Elwood is also a beach suburb - in fact more of a village, than a suburb. Known for its leafy streets, Elwood is also home to great coffee, cafes and dining spots. Please note we have two rooms available via Airbnb. So if this room is not available for the dates you need try our other room (listed separately).
space: Our home is a renovated 4 bedroom Edwardian house with courtyard. This room (1 of 2 rooms we have available) is located downstairs near the front of the house. The room features central heating, w2w carpet, built-in wardrobe with hanging space and shelving, bedside table with lamp, computer desk with an office chair and a large window that opens & locks when closed. Please note: As the house is double brick (and the modem is in the lounge) the wifi signal is not that strong in the bedrooms. However the signal is great in the lounge/dining area and you are welcome to use this space.
host_about: We are a young family who have lived in Elwood (central Melbourne) since 2006. I am self employed and work from home so am here alot. My children attend the local primary school 5 days a week and are not home until around 6pm three nights a week so the house is quiet during the day. We're pet lovers. We also foster dogs so usually have an extra furry friend or two, who stay with us for an unknown time frame (until they get adopted).

Doors open up onto a balcony from the lounge room, which is lovely for those hot summer nights, or for enjoying a cup of coffee on a crisp and sunny Melbourne morning during the cooler months. The kitchen is fitted with all the modern features including a Miele electric oven and gas stove top, with integrated dishwasher and a marble bench top. Should you feel like taking a break from the vast array of local dining options and preparing a meal or two at home all amenities are provided to make this easy and convenient.  You'll find both of the queen sized beds very comfortable and relaxing. There are also built in robes so you can unpack your belongings and really settle in. Floor to ceiling windows co

name: 4/2 Pottery Court Brunswick, Melbourne
summary: Our one bed apartment is ideal for singles or couples. It is perfect for those wanting an inner city experience but not in the CBD. We find lots of people choose the destination because of proximity to relatives or friends and also the variety of very good cafes & pubs.
space: Comfortable secure flat in interesting converted Historic Brickworks in Brunswick. Close to Sydney Road, lots of pubs, bars, cafes and restaurants, plenty of public transport in every direction and on the correct side of the city for the airport. Brunswick has more than it's fair share of Melbourne's best eateries and the location is extremely well served by public transport. Buses stop at the front door which you can jump on if you want to get to Sydney Road or connect you to wherever you are headed, Carlton, the CBD and St Kilda Beach included. Two train stations are a 10 minute walk with a 15 minute ride to the CBD. It is a 2 minute walk to trams taking you to Melbourne Zoo and Melbourne University and the CBD(URL HIDDEN) For our guests convenience we have provided MYKI cards for public transport use around Zone 1. If you use them just top them up at any Post Office or Seven 11 so that future guests can also benefit. They are in the information folder. The complex is large, interest
host_about: I have been hosting on Airbnb since 2011. Now that my husband Ian has retired he has joined with me in the fun of meeting guests from all throughout Australia and around the world. We live in Brunswick as we have family in the suburb and we love to tell everyone visiting Melbourne what a great place Brunswick is. It is blessed with plenty of public transport which makes it easy for travellers to enjoy the CBD, the beaches and all the premier sporting venues that Melbourne excel at. The MCG for cricket and AFL football , Melbourne Tennis Centre for the Australian Open, Flemington Racecourse, home of the Melbourne Cup. These world class venues are a short PTV ride away. Brunswick also offers  great local amenities such as parks, swimming pool, library, bicycle tracks. We enjoy all these with our family, not to mention the food.... Spoilt for choice. Plus bars, pubs and nightclubs............ Maybe not always for us!

space: House Policy At our licensee Homes, we expect residents to respect each other’s right for safety, privacy, and the quiet enjoyment of the property. This means, courtesy, sharing and co-operation in the use of all communal facilities and areas. We strongly believe that, a caring and mutually sharing environment will achieve great benefits, such as, lasting friendships, and an independent lifestyle, as well as, a comfortable and supportive home away from home for all our residents. In order to achieve the above goals for all concerned, we expect residents to follow the Conditions and Responsibilities of our House Rules & Agreement, as set out below: Additional conditions applicable to our Apartment House style living: Section A: SAFETY ISSUES 1.Management forbids excessive drinking by Residents or friends on the premises, as it can lead to drunken and disorderly behavior, resulting in injury to persons and damage to property. 2.No illegal drugs to be brought onto the premises, including
host_about:
Hi, my name is Valeria. My husband Ben and I own and manage a number of upmarket guesthouses located in the inner Melbourne suburbs. 

We specialise in offering a new and unique opportunity to overseas, inter and intrastate visitors, career professionals, academics, post and undergraduates (3rd year and over), trainees, language students, doctors, teachers and other business specialists to gain superior inner Melbourne accommodation and lessen the stresses of moving to a new town, new state or a new country.

We offer fully furnished, centrally located properties with plenty of parking and quality fixtures and furnishings, each has an alfresco entertainment area and BBQ in a garden setting, a fully equipped property in an exclusive professional apartment house environment, where new arrivals, to Melbourne, or people going through a lifestyle transition, can experience an instant community atmosphere for medium (from two weeks), or long term stays, and say goodbye to lonely, restrictive and expensive apartment living.

No more solitary TV dinners! Each property provides apartment house accommodation on a room-by-room basis with shared kitchen, dining and lounge facilities. This style of apartment house living provides opportunities for new arrivals, to Melbourne to quickly, form friendships, build networks with other likeminded people and settle more easily into a new life. This helps to alleviate homesickness and improves their effectiveness in the workplace or place of learning.

A safe and comfortable home life makes for a happier Melbourne experience.

Typical Tenant Profiles

Flexi (Hidden by Airbnb) is open to a wide range of people from professional backgrounds usually between (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) years of age. Typical residents are overseas, inter and intrastate visitors, corporate and career professionals, academics, post and undergraduates (3rd year and over), trainees, language students, doctors, nurses, teachers and other specialists or people in the throes of re-establishing a home and life in Melbourne.

Ben and I hope you choose to stay with us and we have the opportunity to make your stay in Melbourne a life long happy memory.

There is a heating/aircon unit in both the bedroom and living area. The apartment is 200m from Crown and the Yarra riverfront where you can enjoy all the best restaurants Melbourne has to offer.

name: Bungalow near Monash University
summary: Our apartment is clean, spacious, and user-friendly. The main room includes a full kitchen, dining table, queen-sized bed, laptop table with Wi-Fi, and divan (sleeps two). The bathroom has a private shower, wash basin, and toilet.  This quiet spot is walking distance from Monash University, and a short bus ride from Clayton, Oakleigh, and Chadstone Shopping Centre. It designed for wheelchair access, and is suitable for families with children.
space: The space is entirely private. It is situated in the backyard of a student house. Guests have their own kitchen and bathroom. The kitchen is fully stocked with a fridge, stove, oven, microwave, and kettle, so is perfect for self-catering.  Our bungalow is designed for flexibility. The queen-sized bed can fold into the wall for extra space, and the divan can be used for extra bedding if need be. There is also a portacot available for guests with young infants. Outdoors, we have a trampoline, picnic table, and fire pit, which guests are very welcome to use.

summary: You enter from a quiet heritage laneway, with bluestone stables and architectural remnants from the mid 1800's  through our workshop to the studio. It is three storeys and includes two bathrooms,  three bedrooms, living/kitchen, laundry, verandah and views over the rooftops. Two or three minutes walk to Brunswick, Smith or Gertrude streets. Close to all Fitzroy has to offer, yet peaceful at night.
space: Our studio is down a quiet back lane in Fitzroy. we have 1 x Double, 1 x Queen plus 1 x Single beds. We can provide a cot suitable for 0 to about 3, or an extra single bed if you are a family of six. *You enter on the ground level through our workshop. When you enter through your doorway you will find a laundry with washing machine and a separate bathroom with shower and toilet. Also a small bedroom with a single bed. *On the middle level there is a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, fan-forced oven, and all you need to cook...that's if you can resist the many fabulous cafes in the surrounding streets!The living area has comfy couch and opens onto a verandah to take the air and dry the washing. Still on this level a bedroom with queen size bed. We can put a child's cot or a small bed in this common space. *On the top level there's another queen size bed and en-suite bathroom with bath and views over the rooftops. It's well stocked with basic toiletries and basic kitchen
host_about: We both design and make things,objects and wearable and have lived in Fitzroy for a long time and have seen it blossom and grow. We are surrounded by galleries, performance spaces, providores of food, markets and interesting stand alone makers. Wouldn't live anywhere else!

space: The bedroom and bathroom are on the ground floor of the house, the host lives upstairs. Fully furnished with a desk in the bedroom, lots of cupboard space. Comfortable Queen sized bed. Heated floors to keep you warm as toast! And air-conditioning in the summern
host_about: My double storey house is in one of Melbourne's leafy suburbs approximately 6 km from the city centre. I have two children living out of Melbourne and five beautiful grandchildren..Also working in a university as a research fellow in the area of program evaluation. I am an active member of a Rotary group and have a keen interest in my local community. I enjoy walking, sailing and enjoy finding out about other people's lives. I love travel and look forward to meeting new people.   Happy to help others orientate themselves to our neighbourhood and acquaint you with the Australian way of life!

name: Malvern apartment with courtyard
summary: Quiet apartment with private courtyard, Netflix and 2 bicycles in the heart of the inner city suburb of Malvern. Close to public transport (tram no. 5 right outside the front door!) and a short walk to Glenferrie Rd shopping, including Malvern Central Shopping Centre. 24/7 Coles Supermarket around the corner, as well as Dan Murphy's Liquor store. Lot's of lovely parks and green spaces close by.
space: Our apartment is our home, we rent it out when we go on holidays. So we have set it up to be a comfortable home we enjoy, and hope you will too!  We have a spacious living/dining area, separate kitchen, separate bedroom and a second smaller room which is currently being used as a yoga space (could be suitable for a portable cot) which leads out to the courtyard. There is 1 bathroom with a shower over bath and a euro laundry with a washer and dryer. You can also use our clotheshorse to dry your clothes in the courtyard if you prefer to air dry :)
host_about: Hi, I'm Jessica from Australia! I love travelling and meeting people from different countries. I've also lived in Chile and France. I enjoy learning new languages, as well as teaching my own, English! I work as a researcher in human-animal interactions and also as a group fitness and yoga instructor. In my spare time I enjoy reading and vegan cooking. I've had many good experiences as both an AirBnB guest and as a super host when I lived in Provence, France. Now I welcome you to my humble abode in my home country, I hope you enjoy it!

The apartment is 3mins walk from the CBD,  7mins walk from Federation Square, Flinders Station,  Botanic Gardens, & South Bank.

I have a toy cavoodle called "Dave" whom I love more than anything. I really enjoy living in Melbourne and have lots of great restaurant and café recommendations to share.

name: Gatehouse Cottage at Moulton Park Estate
summary: Your own sweet cottage, close to Sherbrooke Forest, King Henry Arts Cafe, The Piggery at Burnham Beeches, Sassafras Village. You’ll love this cosy, romantic retreat just for one couple.   There is an open wood fire, an indulgent spa bath just off the bedroom. Great for couples who need to retreat.
space: The Gatehouse Cottage, set on Moulton Park Estate, is a lovely cottage for two that is elegantly hedged by English box and colourful Camellia’s.  There is an antique stone fireplace in the heart of the living room where a comfortable couch is perfectly positioned to admire its dancing flames. And an antique iron Queen bed and an en-suite with a 2-person spa create a cosy and romantic bedroom for you and your special someone.  The provincial inspired kitchen, with a separate dining room, complete this fully equipped cottage and give you the option to spend the nights in enjoying each others company. Just moments from the property is a walking track that leads you to Sassafras village where you can browse the unique boutiques or afternoon tea at one of the many cafes. A more invigorating walk will place you in the heart of Sherbrooke forest where you can lose yourself amongst the trees.
host_about:
After 24 years offering accommodation in the Dandenong Ranges just an hour from Melbourne, we are now offering a beautiful little group of cottages for Air BNB guests.
We live in The Dandenongs, have lived in Fiji and PNG before moving to Melbourne 30 years ago.     
We have a large family, 2 cats and 2 dogs to keep us in hand!     They will not annoy you as your cottage is on a different property.

host_about:
Hosting people in our lovely old B&B home is what I do. With a lovely team of helpers, we run the award winning Captains Retreat B&B as well as numerous apartments and cottages here in beautiful, historic, waterside Williamstown.  

Interests: Art, Music, Sport, Travel, Movies, Good Food, Good Wine, Good Company and not last by any means Animals, in particular Cats. (note though that Simba and Leo (my so called Lions) are not allowed int the guest part of the house). 

Our lovely old home is just one door from the water, marina and restaurants and has been tastefully renovated so that every room has ensuites (some with spas) and half of the rooms also have gas log fires. One of the rooms has its own private lounge and balcony but other guests can enjoy their choice of two shared lounge rooms as well as a large north facing balcony and delightful private walled garden. 

Other than beds (which are new and very comfortable!!),  I love to buy antique and pre-loved furniture and  have them restored using classic and sometimes quirky fabrics. 

I'm proud to say that we have won numerous awards including 'tourism' and 'hospitality' at the Hobsons Bay region Business excellence awards (3 times) as well as taken out the People's Choice award for the state of Victoria twice in the last three awards. 

Most of our guests are business people or travellers so you can be assured of a quiet, relaxing and private 'home award from home' experience. 
We look forward to welcoming you Williamstown.  
- Melissa

Within minutes of the city's most iconic locations: Emporium, Melbourne Central, Bourke Street Mall, Hardware Lane and Queen Victoria Market to name just a few. Right at the doorstep you can grab a coffee & the best donuts in town at Shortstop and if you love Chinese food make sure you check out China Spice on the corner. For shopaholics, Emporium is a 2 minute walk away and easily the best place to shop in Melbourne. We will have plenty of local insight and tips for you so feel free to ask us. I'm happy to add the third person in this apartment on a mattress on the lounge floor if that suits you, provide all the linen etc.  Fee is $60 per night added to the price. St Kilda is renowned for its expansive view of Port Phillip, safe sandy beach, palm-lined boardwalk, huge range of beach activities, big skies, gorgeous sunsets, lovely park and gardens, great restaurants, bars and cafés, fabulous old buildings, and its colorful past and present

Joe Mottola.

host_about:
Hey, I’m Aymeric!

I’m a French expat from the vineyards of Bordeaux with a love for animals and traveling. At 18, I moved to the USA for 10 years and lived in Boston, Miami Beach and San Francisco while exploring most of Canada, Central and South America. For the past 15 years I’ve lived in Sydney, Australia, mainly because of the beautiful beaches here. On weekends in summer, you can find me volunteering as a surf lifesaver on Tamarama beach.

I work for MaisonNets, a boutique agency specializing in short-term rental management. The MaisonNets portfolio has over 125 properties, encompassing mid-range to luxury apartments and houses in Australia’s capital cities, as well as country homes and a villa in Bali.  

Our properties are all specifically selected for their amenities and prime location - the accommodation of choice for urban sophisticates, professionals, couples and families looking for a uniquely comfortable experience.

With a focus on organic products, MaisonNets offers unparalleled personal service and attention to detail ensuring that you, our valued guest, have a wonderful stay with us.

My wife and I are very positive and trusting people. Easy to get along with and always trying to make a difference to other peoples lives.
We like to go out to dinner at the many restaurants in Melbourne, Nobu is our favourite.   We love to take our boys to the Art Centre, Moomba, Australian Open, Aussie rules football, Basketball and Stage Shows.
I am a trader of derivatives on the equity market and like to go to the stock exchange.
I also am a quadriplegic, complete from C6 down the result of a car accident some 30 years ago.
I/we are a very lucky family and we hope to pass on our positive attack on life to others.  
We look forward to meeting positive and trusting people who likewise care about others.

summary: Stylish, clean and comfortable living with modern enhancements in our Californian Bungalow. Comfortably accommodating 7 people. Free WiFi, Off street parking for two cars. 8 mins to train station, short train ride to heart of Melbourne's CBD or 15 minutes car drive.
space: Our home is a recently renovated, light filled, 1930's Californian Bungalow in the inner bayside suburb of Newport. It comfortably accommodates seven people. Sit by the open fire and enjoy a glass of wine or take in a movie on our Samsung smart TV. We have access to hundreds of movies through Netflix and Foxtel, or enjoy the extensive library of music on the surround sound music system.  We have a brand new kitchen with all the mod cons to prepare a gourmet meal or a quick snack after a day of sightseeing. Enjoy undercover, off street parking. Walk five minutes down our safe, suburban street to the train station and be in the CBD/downtown area in 20 minutes. Our home is 10 kms from the Melbourne CBD by car. You'll be very comfortable in one of three bedrooms including a master with brand new, modern ensuite with bath. A fourth single bed can be set up in the study. We also have a family bathroom and separate washroom.

summary: 房租坐落于澳大利亚墨尔本Glen waverley 中心区域,距离Glen waverley 商业中心2公里,距离墨尔本市中心20公里｡坐公交车或者城市铁路可以直达去市中心｡2公里内也有M1高速公路直达市区｡Glen waverley 生活十分方便,电影院､大型购物中心如Coles和woolworths超市､David  Jones 百货店､Chemist house 药妆店齐全, 中､西､日､韩等各国料理应有尽有;开车前往南大洋最大的购物中心也只需要12分钟的路程｡ 这个别墅所在的区域环境优美､安静舒适｡别墅占地面积737平米,有前后花园｡草地､花园应有尽有｡房屋干净整洁,屋内各种生活必需品齐全,配置有咖啡机和中西式茶具,并无限量免费供应咖啡和茶｡屋内设施(厨房冰箱)租客可以免费使用｡房东提供有偿机场接送和墨尔本地区有偿接送服务｡订房超过7天(含7天)赠送两人份火锅套餐一份｡您在这里一定能享受到人生中最美好的假期｡欢迎您的光临｡ 提供中文､英文､日本语服务｡
space: 本房源是占地737平米的单层别墅｡拥有三间卧室､一间学习室､两间客厅､一个餐厅､一个厨房､两个浴室和一个单独卫生间｡并有洗衣房,配有洗衣机和烘干机｡ 房屋的前后都有花园,紧临房屋的旁边有一个小公园｡ 本房源特别干净整洁,花草树木环绕,花园里适合休闲饮茶,也可以在花园里举办Party 或者BBQ(房东免费提供烧烤炉以及全套BBQ工具)｡ 房屋安装有红外监控设备,为您的安全提供最全面的保障｡

summary: Unwind after a day of sightseeing in this spacious, light-filled retreat - just 12 kms from the city and within easy reach from the airport. From here, you may wish to explore the eclectic array of cafes, bars and shops of neighbouring areas (West Footscray, Footscray, Yarraville and Seddon) or stroll along the nearby Maribyrnong River.  Ask us for suggestions and local tips!
space: Unknown
host_about:
Hi, I'm Veronica.  My family of 3 would love to welcome you to the place we call home! We thoroughly enjoy the company of others and we love hosting people for meals, the odd bbq and for short stays.  Cooking and sharing meals with friends and guests is always a delight and we welcome the opportunity to do so with you. 

Although I personally don't get to travel as much as I'd like, I certainly know what it's like being away from home having lived and worked in Canada, Bosnia and Indonesia - as well as doing a bit of travelling (mostly to SE Asia) in my younger years.  

It's such a joy having a lovely space to retreat to at the end of a long day - and it'd be my absolute pleasure to make such a place available to any weary guests who may wish to stay with us.

Facilities include a state-of-the-art gym with a sauna and steam room, a 25m infinity edge swimming pool and the security of a 24-hour concierge. Located on St Kilda's famous boulevard overlooking St Kilda Pier, all of the areas revered attractions are on your doorstep. Award-winning restaurants, Acland and Fitzroy Street's eclectic shops, the adjoining Esplanade Hotel, beachside walking tracks, a vibrant night life and lazy days on the beach are all accessible in minutes. With bay views from every room, the main bedroom suite features a study area and ultra modern open plan ensuite. The vast living dining area opens to private terrace Which overlooks the bay. The 2nd bedroom is adjacent to the central bathroom with bath.

If it is not us who check you in, it will be our very helpful cleaners/housekeepers who will provide you with just as much information as we would.

If you have a property we will be happy to look after that too. 

Happy travelling!

All mattresses are brand new and with mattress toppers to ensure a comfortable nights sleep. The main open plan living is on this level, modern fully equiped kitchen and main bathroom. There is a Nepresso coffee machine if you can't be bothered walking the 2 minutes to the nearest cafe.  St Kilda Junction is a 2 min walk, with trams to the city.  Fitzroy street a 5 to 10 min walk or 2 min tram ride. Markets on the weekends, the vibe in this area is hard to beat. Walk to Donovans Restaurant and Stokehouse.

name: LUXICO - Lansell Manhattan
summary: Take pleasure in the luxurious design of Lansell Manhattan which sits quietly in an exclusive pocket of Toorak, in Melbourne’s inner south-east. This contemporary 3-bedroom home is part of an architecturally designed multi-residential residence, with a second home in this new build also available for rent. Spacious living areas, meticulous styling, a private landscaped courtyard and high-end finishes will have you wanting to extend your stay!
space: Lansell Manhattan will capture your attention from the outset with its striking white exterior and vast glazing inviting you to step inside. The interior offers large light-filled luxurious spaces perfect for entertaining and of course relaxing. At the front of the home is a lounge area where a clever mix of metallics and textured furnishings create a sophisticated space ideal for a quiet conversation. The generous hallway walls are lined with dark joinery contrasting with the largely white interior walls and ceiling. The dark joinery also features in the study, which is located off the hallway. At the rear of the home you’ll find the spacious open-plan living/dining area. Floor-to-ceiling doors and windows allow plenty of light to enter and give you refreshing views of the private courtyard. This is undoubtedly the true heart of the home and you will want to spend a lot of time in here as you have the luxury of a divine Caesar Stone kitchen complete with Gaggenau appliances. There’s a
host_about:
Why stay in a hotel when you can enjoy the space and amenity of a designer home?

Luxico manages designer and luxury homes across Melbourne, Sydney, Palm Beach, Byron Bay, Noosa and the Mornington Peninsula with many new locations coming in 2018.

All Luxico homes are  fully equipped with 5-star linens, towels, luxury toiletries, gourmet welcome hampers, free Wi-Fi and all the essential items that you will require during your stay.

Luxico's Housekeeping and Concierge Services teams are on hand to assist with airport transfers, grocery deliveries, catering, extra cleaning and anything else you might require.

Guests travelling with children can request toys, activities, travel cots and high chairs, whilst pet owners have a number of great properties to choose from with doggy beds, water bowls and other items provided to minimize your luggage.

summary: This brand new gorgeous two bedroom & two bathroom apartment with free carpark is perfect for families or travelling with friends! You’ll find yourself right at home lounging on large and comfortable sofa with a wide TV watching Netflix or getting some work done with your favourite music.  The Resting Room x2  Both bedrooms is fitted with a luxury queen bed. The bed has a mixture of textures and come together with feather quilt to make your nights rest more enjoyable.  The Eating Space  This apartment has a fully equipped kitchen with all your needs in mind. There is ample storage and a dishwasher. All you will need to do is bring your food to cook up a great meal. Or pop in last nights meal into the microwave. Just off the kitchen is a 4 seat dining table to have a meal or get some work done.  The Refreshing Room  The new modern bathroom has everything you could need including a overhead rain shower.  >> Since you’re staying with Donkey Kong, we provide all bathroom e
host_about:
Donkey Kong is a short stay property management company founded in 2017 that takes the hassle out of Airbnb hosting, changing the way residential real estate is leased. 

We try our best to ensure all our properties are safe, secure and controlled throughout the whole rental process, we takes care of our guests from check-in to check-out, offering the best comfort and service possible.

If you are interested in one of the properties we have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check our other listings under the profile or please email me through airbnb messaging system, as l will likely have another apartment/home available that will suit your needs. 

Any questions please don't hesitate to call out, look forward to chat with you about your finer requirements.

There is also a small enclosed balcony area that has full height windows to let in some natural light and fresh air. The bedroom also has windows and
host_about:
I'm Linton, I own and run a short-stay management company, Beyond a Room, here in Melbourne. If you book with me you'll be communicating with both myself and my staff.

I’m an entrepreneur, architecture graduate, photographer, cyclist (NOT the lycra kind), volunteer, adventurer and problem solver.

During my studies I worked at various cafes and architecture offices to save up for shoestring trips around the world. My grandma once told me I had ‘champagne taste but a beer budget’ and it’s a motto I’ve enjoyed applying to different parts of my life to get the more out of less and find enjoyment in the little things.

I love discovering authentic experiences when I travel and I love being able to share the opportunity with others, to live like a local when they travel too.

Some of my most memorable trips have been couch-surfin across Russia while taking the Trans Siberian, living in Helsinki and learning to hand build furniture, riding a vintage steel bicycle through France to race in L’Eroica and buying a car on craigzlist in Los Angeles and driving across the south, east and north coasts to arrive in Vancouver.

My listings are all managed by Beyond a Room and are all given names that I think reflect the character of the property and area. My aim is to give guests a unique and local perspective on the location and share my knowledge and experience of this wonderful city with travellers so that they feel at home. Search Beyond a Room to find out more about how we can help manage your airbnb.

I try to keep all my calendars up to date so if it’s available in the calendar, you can usually just go ahead and book

name: Rewarding Richmond Location-Outstanding Apartment!
summary: Welcome to my amazing apartment located in the quintessential suburb of Richmond.  Extremely close to the thriving heart of Melbourne with easy access to public transport, Richmond exemplifies inner-city cool with a diverse cosmopolitan population, and access to everything Melbourne is most well known for – restaurants, cafés, bars, cool shopping, street culture and sporting venues. My stylish and spacious home is perfect for a group of friends or a family on your next fun getaway to the city!
space: It will be a pleasure to host you in my fantastic state-of-the-art apartment on your next getaway to iconic Richmond. My home is located in a multi-award winning apartment complex located a couple of minutes walk from Bridge Rd – one of the most exciting streets in the city. The large open plan living area is modern, spacious and free flowing, and leads out onto a huge entertainer’s balcony – a fantastic area for enjoying a morning cup of coffee, or just chilling out on a relaxing Melbourne day. You’ll also find the lounge room couch really comfortable for those cosy nights in with a glass of wine and a movie on the TV.     The gourmet kitchen has stone bench tops, stainless steel appliances, a dishwasher and an island bench – just prefect for preparing meals at home with locally sourced ingredients and goodies (if you get tired of the extensive outside dining options right on your doorstep that is!)   The two bedrooms are quiet and comfortable – both very spacious with queen sized bed

There is a basic kitchen with a coffee machine so you can cook up a mini storm and have a delightful morning coffee to start your day.  The bed is a really comfortable Queen with a coconut fibre and latex mattress along (firm) with feather and memory foam pillows. There is good quality clean linen and towels for you to use during your stay as well as shampoo, conditioner and a hairdryer in the bathroom so you don't have to bring these along on your trip. The apartment is also equipped with a iron and ironing board and a heater for those chilly nights. There is also a portacot available upon request :)

INCREDIBLE apartment in the heart of the Botanical St Kilda Rd district only minutes to Melbourne CBD. FREE WIFI, PARKING, and very convenient GYM in the building. This architecturally inspired building is only a year or so old and is set right between Albert Park Lake and the botanical gardens precinct. It is the premier location for any visit to Melbourne: the trams along St Kilda road will drop you in the city within 5 minutes and also the funky and vibrant restaurants and cafes of St Kilda are only a few tram stops or a short walk away.  The space includes 2 bedrooms, open plan kitchen with a wonderful entertainers balcony with views to Albert Park lake and Port Phillip bay and beyond.  Each bedroom contains 1 comfortable bed (queen in main and double in second) with an additional so
host_about:
Hi! My name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am an avid traveller (Ive visited more than 55 countries and counting) and enjoy soaking in cultures from all parts of the world whenever i get the opportunity.

When in Melbourne I run a unique short stay apartment business that i am so fortunate to call my day job. I love meeting and hosting guests and doing my best to enhance their Melbourne experience. I do have a small team behind me so it may not always be me you hear from. 

I am very proud to have been named an AIRBNB Superhost for a couple of years now. What does that mean to you? I have never cancelled a guest's  booking and close to 90% of the reviews we receive are rated 5 stars by our guests. You can be confident if you book a property with us firstly the keys will always be there when you turn up and we will do everything we can to ensure you have a wonderful stay.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings or email me an enquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I can't wait to host you or meet you soon!

Paul, Complete Host

name: Aquila Nova Retreat - Sol Spa Suite
summary: Unknown
space: Set in almost an acre of English gardens, Aquila Nova Retreat is the ideal setting for a romantic getaway, an extended holiday exploring the beautiful Dandenong Ranges, or for an overnight BREAK from the city. The Sol suite is a chalet-style accommodation featuring a tasteful blend of wood, stone and vibrant colours reminiscent of the sun’s golden palette. With a drawbridge entrance, a castellated stone balcony, a four poster queen bed and a massive spa bath overlooking a gas log fire, this suite is truly mesmerising. The newly renovated kitchenette, bathroom and BBQ facilities will ensure ultimate comfort while the beautiful décor and luxurious furnishings promise to entice the senses.

name: Unique Pickled Onion Factory Warehouse Conversion
summary: A quirky, one-of-a-kind home located on the edge of Clifton Hill and Collingwood, one of the most sought after areas to live in Melbourne - only 5km from the CBD, 10 minutes on public transit. Quiet, private, beautifully and stylishly furnished, you will find it hard to resist wanting to stay here. Welcome!
space: Many years ago, the space was once an old pickled onion factory. Over the years, the home has gone through stages of transformation into an eccentric but warm and lovely place that we call home. It’s beautifully and stylishly furnished with a hint of playfulness and includes a number of items that we have picked up around the world during our travels. For the cooler nights, the little potbelly fireplace in the living room can be lit to warm up the room. Upstairs, we have two spacious open-plan bedrooms, along with a fully functional kitchen, toilet with shower and a little balcony to enjoy your morning coffee.  It’s been decorated with style and flair. It’s unusual, it’s one of a kind, and it’s definitely kooky… and we wouldn’t change a thing! Just watch your head when you walk through those doorways… LIVING ROOM Free high-speed wireless internet connection Flat-screen LCD TV with USB outlets and HDMI leads Blu-Ray DVD player Sofa lounge and armchairs Washing machine Dryer Clothes dryi
host_about:
Hello! I'm Chris. My partner Brett and I produce and manage a circus/cabaret/variety show and have travelled extensively with it over the last ten years. Our work often takes us to some wonderful locations around the world, and we have toured throughout much of Europe and North America. Brett grew up in a sleepy idyllic town on the beach called Moonta in South Australia, and I am originally from beautiful Vancouver, Canada.

We call Australia home, although we don't often get to spend as much time there as we would like, because of work. We now live between Sydney, Melbourne and London. We have been lucky enough to get to present the show over several years in Sydney and fell in love with the Potts Point area, which is why we jumped when the opportunity to purchase this apartment came up. We also recently purchased an iconic property in the beautiful beach town of Brunswick Heads, New South Wales.

We love travelling and after having stayed in many hotel rooms and apartments over the years, we definitely know what we look for when staying away from home, and we have tried our best to make our homes as comfortable, well-stocked and convenient for guests as possible. We look forward to hearing from you!

Albert Park property

name: HOME away from HOME, stunning views & sunsets.
summary: My place is lovely for solo adventurers, business travellers, and couples. With views spanning from Mount Martha to the Macedon Ranges. Only 11 KMS from city centre, and close to a range of gorgeous local offerings & amenities to ensure a most enjoyable stay.
space: This Marcus Barlow-designed residence is a joy to experience. This house has a  formal sitting and dining with views, a sunny kitchen, a main bathroom and separate shower guest bathroom, established gardens, ducted heating, security doors. There are several things to do locally and a 10 min walk to the Surrey Hills train station will have you in the CBD in 20mins on an express train service. This charming shopping village has always held a special ambiance where long established, traditional shops mingle with the contemporary. name: Skyhigh Panoramic | Sub - Penthouse Level
summary: Welcome to your own Southbank sub - penthouse. Perch yourself high up amongst the multi-million dollar views this masterpiece has to offer.  Enjoy the "street" style of Melbourne, whilst overlooking the hustle and bustle of the city.  Comfortably furnished, with views to kill for - don't miss staying in this highly sought after address. space: The Space enjoys uninterrupted views towards the city and Southbank.  A large private balcony is the perfect place to enjoy a cool refreshment, or dine alfresco with stunning views.  The apartment can sleep 6 adults and is a very secure building.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Nate!

I am a local Southbank resident and have a passion for the new people powered economy that exists today. 

I work with a team of amazing individuals to provide a unique experience for each of my guests. 

I also have a team of 5-Star luxury vehicle drivers. We can pick up / drop off 24 - 7 - 365. We offer fully catered day trips on request ( wineries , great ocean road, hot springs, event drop off / collection ). 

Throughout my professional life, i have been one to travel quite a lot - and know the importance of a safe, comfortable place to relax and unwind. Thanks for checking out my profile, hope to share my spaces with you soon! 

TOP 5 THINGS TO DO IN SOUTHBANK:

1)     NGV - what more can i say? Amazing place! 
2)    Melbourne Arts Centre - the Eiffel tower of Aus!
3)    Convention Centre - this is where the Terminator himself hosts his annual event. The " Arnold Classic ". - You will be back ( there is also chopper rides ). 
4)    Eureka Skydeck 88.  297m high. You may need a drink following the experience. 
5)    PonyFish Island Bar. Cool spot for a Gin and Tonic. 

Look forward to speaking to you! 

- Nate

name: Charming house in central Melbourne
summary: Delightful quiet furnished house in Carlton North (Prince’s Hill) is available for sub-let for 4-5 weeks between 1 January and 10 February. Please note that we are (probably) looking for someone for 4 weeks minimum!
space: “What a nice space!” - people say. Delightful quiet furnished house in Carlton North (Prince’s Hill) is available for sub-let for 4-6 weeks between 1 January and 10 February. Features: Large beautiful airy light-filled living room with rooflight Gas kitchen - plenty of kitchen equipment Tasteful minimalist furniture (Japanese style) Main bedroom with BIRs and queen-size mattress Second bedroom with double futon - which you can easily move into the living room and sleep under the stars if you wish :-) (Extra basic fold-up mattress + blow up mattress if needed) Bathroom with natural light, includes real bath Broadband connection, landline, TV connection + extra screen (plug into your laptop), printer One minute walk to trams / 10 minutes by bicycle to CBD Close to cafes / restaurants (Lygon, Rathdowne Streets), supermarkets, parks, laundrette, etc. All this for $550/week! Please note: we would prefer someone who books for 4 weeks+, but 2x2+ will work too.
host_about:
Where to start? I'm British/Australian and have also lived in Germany, Spain, Japan and Canada. After many years teaching English I now work as a Reiki teacher and life coach, but I'm definitely not one of those scary stereotypical hyperactive life coaches :) Being my own boss means choosing when I travel, which is often! I've visited many places but now mostly keep going back to India, Japan, France and Spain. I've been a Buddhist since University but most people wouldn't notice - I come across as "normal" :-) 
What do I like? Lots of things! Hiking, yoga, languages, conversation, reading about history/other cultures, animals (especially cats and geese). And food! (I'm vegetarian here at home but not usually when I'm travelling). 
As a guest I'm quiet, respectful, super-tidy but not bothered about chaos around me (I go to India, after all ...), and will feed your cat if you're out. I have a fun sense of humour and am tolerant and easy-going. 
I tend to spend longer periods in one place rather than rush around from city to city. My current trip is 2 months (December to February) in Europe where I'll be visiting my mother and an old uni friend, both in England, revisiting Germany in the snow, and then teaching Reiki in Amsterdam.

summary: Discover St Kilda Accommodation Junction conveniently located at the gateway of St Kilda and Fitzroy Roads with 2 tram stops at your doorstep with trams directly to Melbourne CBD.  In the other direction, trams can take you to St Kilda Beach or to the outer suburbs of East Brighton, Malvern or Carnegie.  Whether you are after a quick post-swim meal or an anniversary dinner with sunset views of St Kilda Beach, here are some of the best restaurants in Melbourne's multicultural beachside suburb.
space: While other accommodation facilities may insist on splitting the family and large group to book an additional apartment, we endeavour to keep everyone together in our recently renovated one-bedroom and two-bedroom apartments which each feature full kitchen and laundry facilities, as well as a flat-screen television and Wi-Fi access. All open onto a private balcony.  To keep to your fitness routine, there is an onsite gym and sauna and a couple of 24 hours offsite fitness centres about a 3 minutes’ walk from our property. Whether you are here for business or pleasure, our friendly and accommodating staff is here to help make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible.  Follow the instructions on the login page. The daily access is limited to 500mb for general email and light searches only.  You may purchase bigger plans - please inquire when you check in.
host_about:
I love to travel the world and have lived in many countries.  I like to listen and share stories with people from all over the world.  I like the global trend of co-living in shared accommodation at an affordable cost per bed so that more people can have the opportunity to experience what Melbourne, the '5-times voted' most liveable city in the world, has to offer without 'breaking your budget'.

I love to try cuisines from different parts of the world and Melbourne is the place to try all types of cuisines as it has become a melting pot of people and cultures.   I will direct you to the cafes/restaurants that serves your 'to die for' food cravings.
