host_about: I am a hard working person and enjoy communicating with anyone and everyone. I love being an Airbnb host as it gives me a chance to help others and provide exceptional service. I love helping people make money and I experimented on my own apartment with Airbnb. It's been empty 27 days in 4 years. I now have 16 under Airbnb. They are properties that I have bought for investors (I'm a buyers advocate) and for landlords who wanted (needed) to double their incomes.  I take a budget and I purchase all the furnishing down to the potato peeler,  accept the deliveries, set it up, wash the towels, take the photographs and then list it on Airbnb. My motto is "We do everything for you except pay for it and move in." As the short stay business has grown let me introduce Motaz Alamarat. Motaz is my colleague and was head of "front of house" at a 5 star resort in Jordan. He is the most gorgeous young man and his mind set is completely focused on ensuring all our guests have an enjoyable experience. Most of the time Motaz will meet and greet our guests any time day or night. I help out where needed. He will ensure that the apartment is clean and everything is working on your arrival. We look to ensure our landlord's property achieves a 4.8 star score.

The renovated bathroom contains a shower, vanity, exhaust fan, ample hanging space and fresh towels are provided in the price. host_about:
We have lived in the inner city Melbourne suburb of Fitzroy for most of our adult lives. We love the parks, the houses, the diversity and of course the coffee and food of Fitzroy.

We travel often with our favourite locations being New York, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Hawaii, London, Paris and Berlin. While on holiday we like to explore the streets, get around by public transport and sample the food and coffee.

We bring a professional approach to hosting by providing excellent accomodation in fantastic Fitzroy locations and detailed "how to" information. We want our guests to have a great stay and of course highly recommend our 3 apartments (Fantastic Fitzroy Garden Apartment .... Fantastic Fitzroy Treetop Apartment .... name: City Penthouse with Parking near Melbourne Central
summary: Stay in this penthouse apartment for the perfect balance of everything that Melbourne has to offer -  with hundreds of sights to see and food to eat. Located right in the middle of the city and at Melbourne Central, everything you need is within walking distance. Melbourne's best highlights are its streets, and this place is the first step for your amazing visit. This is the most affordable, luxurious and spacious apartment in the Heart of Melbourne - all within the privacy of the 40th floor.
space: The LIVING ROOM contains a sofa, a coffee table and a flat screen TV. For extra guests, the sofa pulls open to become a sofa bed. The dining area has been furnished with a dining table for meals. There is a heating and air-conditioning unit in the living room, but please switch it off when not in use - we deeply appreciate it! The master BEDROOM contains a king bed, and a double sized bed in the other bedroom. All beds come with fresh, clean luxury linens and an all seasons quilts to keep you warm throughout the year. There is also sufficient storage space for your belongings and hangers for your clothes. Upon arrival, you will find the BATHROOM stocked with body wash, hand soap, shampoo and conditioner for you and your group. We also provide toilet paper and bath towels, as well as a hair dryer, iron, washing machine and dryer available for your use. The KITCHEN is fully equipped with basic cooking items, such as a kettle, microwave, stove-top, oven, toaster, cutlery and dining ware.
host_about:
Roomerang is an end-to-end short stays team based in Melbourne.

We are avid travellers and know how hard it can be to find comfortable and cosy, yet affordable accommodation. We try to remove all the complications surrounding your stay, so you can focus on other important aspects of your trip. And if you feel we have left anything out, let us know and we would love to help.

Roomerang provides professionally cleaned and well-kept, affordable stays presenting you with a home to return to no matter who you are, where you're from or what you are here for!

Worry not about your towels because we have pr
host_about:
My family moved to Melbourne around 15 years ago and we feel blessed by every bits and alleys of this gorgeous city.

About me - I am an IT graduate from RMIT University Melbourne and worked in tech company for last few years. Now, I'm running accommodation business with my brother. We are hosting a number of apartments around Melbourne CBD and ensure the rooms are guest-ready all the time.

Aside from working, we love travel and enjoy great coffee, so you bet we can recommend you some of iconic Melbourne brunch places and cafes that definitely make your stay in Melbourne memorable.

host_about:
I'm a final year Engineering student studying nearby at Melbourne University.

I work part-time as a software developer and often work from some of the nearby cafes. I am also building a satellite with the Melbourne Space Program. My interests are in the healthcare and aerospace fields.

I also try and squeeze in the occasional rock-climbing session, followed by dumplings or ramen.

name: Stylish Apartment with City Views!
summary: A modern and spacious apartment in trendy  North Melbourne. Moments  from local eateries, a perfect base to explore.  Stroll to the CBD and Queen Victoria market or take the tram that passes by. Downstairs includes a bathroom with spa bath, bedroom with Queen size bed and Euro laundry. Upstairs, the kitchen includes a Smeg oven, dishwasher, well appointed dining area and lounge with split system air con/heating.  The living area opens to an outdoor entertaining area with enviable city views.
space: An enviable and large outdoor deck which opens up from the lounge area and appreciates brilliant city views.  (Perfect for watching fireworks on New Years!)  A dual level, individually designed apartment. A full service kitchen with European appliances - great for preparing produce from the nearby Queen Victoria Market.  Powerful shower.  Spa bath. Ample cupboard and storage space. Brilliant location perched near Errol St and a short walk to the Queen Victoria market and CBD.
host_about:
I'm a Melbournian who loves to eat well and travel. 

My properties in the Melbourne CBD, North Melbourne and Flemington offer very convenient access to the city, they are tastefully decorated and, of course, are private and secure.  Just enjoy!  

I'm a friendly host and will happily provide any information you require about the local area or Melbourne generally.  I have the airbnb app on my smart phone, so can readily be contacted if you have any questions.  Please feel free to ask.

name: One bedroom in gorgeous terrace, family-friendly
summary: Sunny inner city terrace house opposite park.  Lots of cafes, public transport and shops close by.  Children welcome. Close to Brunswick St, Lygon St and Sydney Rd's restaurants and culture. First time available.
space: This area is lovely - there are 16 cafes within a 4 minute walk, so heaps of places to eat out, but there's a supermarket very close by, and I have a large kitchen in which 3 people can cook at once, so if you want to stay in and cook for the kids, you can easily do so. The park across the road has a nice kid's play area and there's another two play parks 5 mins walk towards Rushall station. My space is set up for grandkids so you don't have to be too careful ... the floors are painted wood, it's reasonably childproofed, and there's plenty of space for little ones. They can bounce on the couch :-)
host_about:
I really enjoy learning something new - so I enjoy other cultures, other languages, other points of view.  I have two children in their thirties, one in Melbourne,  and am really close to them and my two grandchildren. I'm originally from NZ, and my son still lives there in the most beautiful part of the world, the Coromandel peninsula :-). 

I work hard, as I am a lecturer at RMIT University in Melbourne. I really enjoy my job. When I do have time to myself I spend it with friends, seeing foreign movies, especially French, Spanish and Scandinavian, reading fiction, keeping fit, or going to see dance or live music. I can speak some Norwegian, Swedish,  a bit of French, and am learning Spanish ... languages are my passion in  life.

summary: A beautiful, modern apartment in Melbourne's prestigious Southbank region. With full amenities, 2 bedrooms, and a parking space, this gives you the best of all worlds. Relax with your morning coffee on the balcony, or enjoy the nightlife along the banks of the river. Whatever you feel like indulging in, this is the perfect place to start.
space: Unknown
host_about:
I'm Linton, I own and run a short-stay management company, Beyond a Room, here in Melbourne. If you book with me you'll be communicating with both myself and my staff.

I’m an entrepreneur, architecture graduate, photographer, cyclist (NOT the lycra kind), volunteer, adventurer and problem solver.

During my studies I worked at various cafes and architecture offices to save up for shoestring trips around the world. My grandma once told me I had ‘champagne taste but a beer budget’ and it’s a motto I’ve enjoyed applying to different parts of my life to get the more out of less and find enjoyment in the little things.

I love discovering authentic experiences when I travel and I love being able to share the opportunity with others, to live like a local when they travel too.

Some of my most memorable trips have been couch-surfin across Russia while taking the Trans Siberian, living in Helsinki and learning to hand build furniture, riding a vintage steel bicycle through France to race in L’Eroica and buying a car on craigzlist in Los Angeles and driving across the south, east and north coasts to arrive in Vancouver.

My listings are all managed by Beyond a Room and are all given names that I think reflect the character of the property and area. My aim is to give guests a unique and local perspective on the location and share my knowledge and experience of this wonderful city with travellers so that they feel at home. Search Beyond a Room to find out more about how we can help manage your airbnb.

I try to keep all my calendars up to date so if it’s available in the calendar, you can usually just go ahead and book

name: Cosy 1BDR with lush green views in South Melbourne
summary: Cute and cozy home within a classic architecturally designed building. Plenty of greenery, solid brick and designer lamps to keep you calm, warm and inspired. The bedroom has a little study desk overlooking the balcony and further afar. A day bed in the living room is ideal for a couple of friends travelling together or the last minute extra on your Melbourne adventure. During my studies I worked at various cafes and architecture offices to save up for shoestring trips around the world. My grandma once told me I had ‘champagne taste but a beer budget’ and it’s a motto I’ve enjoyed applying to different parts of my life to get the more out of less and find enjoyment in the little things.

I love discovering authentic experiences when I travel and I love being able to share the opportunity with others, to live like a local when they travel too.

Some of my most memorable trips have been couch-surfin across Russia while taking the Trans Siberian, living in Helsinki and learning to hand build furniture, riding a vintage steel bicycle through France to race in L’Eroica and buying a car on craigzlist in Los Angeles and driving across the south, east and north coasts to arrive in Vancouver.

My listings are all managed by Beyond a Room and are all given names that I think reflect the character of the property and area. My aim is to give guests a unique and local perspective on the location and share my knowledge and experience of this wonderful city with travellers so that they feel at home. Search Beyond a Room to find out more about how we can help manage your airbnb.

I try to keep all my calendars up to date so if it’s available in the calendar, you can usually just go ahead and book

Hello! Thank you for visiting my page - this is my brand new apartment - 2 bed 2 bath , located in the heart of Melbourne city. 

The apartment oozes style and epic Melbourne City views- being on the 49 floor. 

I'm like chic and modern style, I've given the apartment a modern touch. You will love staying at my luxury apartment.

I'm a white collar worker, with a passion for travel. I've travelled to Europe, Asia, America and Mexico. So I know exactly what you're looking for when you're away from home in a new city, and the importance of feeling comfort of home. 

Apartment features: 
-Miele S/S appliances

name: Room with a view
summary: Prime location, French provincial decorated warm apartment, with skyline views of the city and the Yarra River, situated just behind Crown Casino.  Separate bathroom, large windows, high quality linen and towels, bathroom accessories, within arts, sport, coffee shops and restaurant district.
space: The apartment is located on higher level of one of the secured skyscrapers, with beautiful views around the clock.  Décor is generally French Provincial with contemporary style in an artist apartment.  A large balcony can also be accessed where you could have coffee or breakfast during the summer months.  I have a few pots there too, sometimes fresh tomatoes and herbs for your enjoyment.  There is access also to a swimming pool, gym and tennis courts on the premises.
host_about:
I love travelling and have been every time I have a little bit of money and time off from work.  I have been lucky enough to have travelled to Europe, US and Canada, Asia and would love to go to Africa in the near future.  
My professional background is in the occupational health and safety, environment and quality.  I have been involved with a variety of industries trying to minimise business risks as well as safety and environmental risks for employees and community.  
AirBnB experience has now enabled more and more people to travel and learn about new cultures.  This opens not the traveller’s horizon, but the hosts as well.   That’s what I like most about it!
I love living in sunny Melba and consider myself a Melbourknight.  Melbourne is a very culturally diverse city, and offers amazing food and cultural experiences from across the globe. There are wonderful cultural events (many for free) and restaurants to explore. 
I hope you will like staying with me at my place, enjoy the views and everything the city has to offer.

space: NOTE: the receptionist on the ground floor is building manager, they only in charged in problems of the building, and they only work with the owner of the apartment, please call me for any queries or question instead of asking them as they may not give you satisfied answers. LATE CHECK IN SERVICE FEE (after 9pm) is $30 Good location, walking distance to biggest train station(Southern Cross), super markets(Coles, Asian groceries), free tram lines within Melbourne CBD New apartment with new modern furnitures Air conditioner Kitchen and laundry available with front load washing machine and dryer To see Melbourne at your feet Security access Free wifi (ID and password will be seen on router inside the apartment) In-door heated swimming pool and gym also available for
host_about:
Hi, I'm Vicky, a friendly person. I love travelling, cooking and decorating.
I've been using Airbnb for my trips since 2011 so that I understand the needs for a holiday accommodation. It's not only about a good location but also about a good quality of the house itself. 
As I'm trying to bring all the best as I can to my apartments and it's also a way I'm bringing to you, my Airbnb guests the best experiences for your trips :)
I hope you'll have a great time in my place

Welcome to Melbourne!

See you soon

summary: Welcome to your Melbourne retreat, somewhere to relax after a day out exploring the city. Docklands offers convenience to the city and our apartment offers you a space to relax with bay views, pool, gym, and shops, restaurants and bars nearby.
space: Reasons to stay: 1. Clean modern apartment with cool ocean breezes and plenty of amenities 2. Beautiful views of the harbour and bay from our 19th floor apartment 3. 5 FREE tram routes direct through the CBD operating from our doorstep, 2 of which run 24 hours on Friday and Saturday nights 4. 10 mins walk to Southern Cross Station and 15 mins walk to the CBD 5. Right next to Etihad stadium 6. Right next to harbour town shopping centre and 15 mins walk to Southwharf Direct Factory Outlet (DFO) 7. Melbourne bikeshare for hire on our doorstep 8. 100's of restaurants, bars and cafes nearby 9. Access to the building gym and pool 10. 3 hour free car parking within 5 mins walk and all day car parking for $10 11. Use of apartments' washing machine, dishwasher, oven, gas stove, BBQ, and fridge. 12. Unlimited WIFI 13. Beautiful spot to people watch and enjoy a beverage on the balcony 14. Tea and coffee supplied 15. Ice skating rink next door 16. Melbourne Star next door (1 of 3 super ferris whee
host_about:
Kristie loves the beach, travel, languages, cooking, rom-coms, yoga, fun runs, meeting new people, eating out at many of Melbourne's restaurants, trying to grow herbs and gardening.

Sam loves skiing, running, travel, fishing, reading, Denzel Washington & Mark Wahlberg movies, BBQing, and drinking vodka lime sodas on a hot summer day.

name: BnB on Chomley
summary: This awesome open plan, 1-bedroom apartment is filled with natural light throughout the day & feels cosy & warm at night.  It sleeps up to four adults (1x queen bed in bedroom and 1x double foldout sofa bed in lounge) and has its own private balcony & off street parking. BnB on Chomley is only minutes away from the famous Chapel street shopping precinct, restaurants, cafes/bars & walking distance to High Street shops and Hawksburn Village with trains/trams just a hop, step and a jump away!
space: The space has a really great energy / vibe to it thanks to a number of factors working together - a modern and clutter free set up of furniture with an abundance of natural sunlight during the day and lighting options that cater for any mood in the evening.  The bathroom (with separate toilet) is stylish, yet functional and is large enough to include a 6kg top loader washing machine with washing detergent provided for your convenience. And of course shampoo, conditioner and bodywash are also available for use at your leisure. There's nothing worse than cheap, crappy pillows to sleep on. All four pillows in the apartment are of a high quality feather/down mix. The queen, spring pocket mattress in the bedroom is brand spankin new and I've tried to make the fold out sofa bed as comfy as a fold out couch can be by providing a thick foam eggshell topper for posture support.
host_about:
Easy going guy, loves spending time with family and friends.

A bit about me personally... I love to create: short films, corporate videos, music videos, lifestyle content, promo videos, birthday videos and more. Check out my YouTube Channel if you're interested. Just search CJI Productions in YouTube.

As an Airbnb Host my style is kind of 'flexible/adaptable' in that I mould to the needs of my guest(s). For example, you want a more visible host I would most likely meet you for check-in and checkout.  However, you'd prefer an invisible host I would arrange self check-in for your arrival. And of course, I'm only just a phone call away if you need me for anything at all.

The only expectation I have for all Airbnb guests staying at 'BnB on Chomley' is that you respect the apartment (and its belongings) like it is your own and leave it in the same condition as you found it.

name: Huge, modern and sunny with resort facilities
summary: Huge one bedroom apartment in South Yarra with beautiful views. Walk to CBD, Chapel St, Prahran Food Mkts, Yarra River and the MCG. Five minute train to Convention & Exhibition Centre, Emporium, Federation Square, National Gallery Victoria & Monash University.  - Tastefully furnished, open-plan living - FREE WiFi - Flatscreen UHD TV with Foxtel - Gourmet gas kitchen - Parking - Bedroom with built in wardrobes - Ducted air-conditioning/heating - Internal laundry - Onsite Gym + Pool
space: The apartment is one block from Chapel St, famous for its bakeries, coffee shops, restaurants, galleries and nightlife. Woolworths supermarket and trams and train station are also nearby. There is a large open plan living and dining room with a gourmet kitchen. A large bedroom and bathroom (including laundry). Enjoy dinner overlooking South Yarra from your own secluded balcony. Your bedroom contains a queen bed with a comfortable new Sealy orthopaedic mattress, bedsides, lamp and a laptop friendly desk and chair. There is also a full length wardrobe, with mirror doors and plenty of hanging space. All linens are new and fluffy towels included! Your bathroom is fully equipped with shampoo, conditioner, body wash, a hair dryer, a washing machine and a clothes dryer. The complex has a lift, well equipped gym, pool, hot spa & a courtyard garden that you can use.
host_about: I've lived in various parts of the world and eventually settled in Melbourne for its vibrant culture, fabulous restaurants and some of the friendliest people you'll ever meet! I enjoy exchanging stories with like-minded travelers and business travelers. I'm a project manager for work and when I'm not working, I'm reading a great book, going hiking or visiting friends in far flung locations.

name: Merigold on Collins CBD Cafes Close to everything
summary: Perfect for two, your very modern studio apartment is amazingly located in the middle of the CBD's cafe, restaurant and shopping district. It is inside a classic, heritage, Melbourne CBD building (called Merigold on Collins) with a security entrance. Although is strictly a studio apartment, there are large block-out blinds that give the bedroom complete privacy and restrict most of the light from coming into the bedroom area. The living area windows overlook Collins St below.
space: (Please note that this apartment is newly listed with StayCentral, and these are only the initial photos posted to give an representation of the property. The property is actually mush lighter than it appears in these photos). Perfect for two, your very modern studio apartment is amazingly located in the middle of the CBD's cafe, restaurant and shopping district. It is inside a classic, heritage, Melbourne CBD building (called Merigold on Collins) with a security entrance. Although is strictly a studio apartment, there are large block-out blinds that give the bedroom complete privacy and restrict most of the light from coming into the bedroom area. The living area windows overlook Collins St below. Your swish Melbourne boutique, serviced apartment includes very modern, high quality furnishings and appliances, linen, towels, and large kitchen with lots of storage space. Opening windows allow fresh air through all rooms when you want it. This is only one of many beautiful, boutique, inne
host_about:
A mining engineer by profession, I have owned two other service businesses since 1998. I started StayCentral when I purchased one apartment in 2005, and now manage multiple properties in many different locations in inner Melbourne.

Like many of my guests, I love to travel; both overseas on epic journeys (including remote locations like the Mulu Caves in Borneo, ancient cities (in Nepal, Turkey, Peru & Jordan), Antarctica & Alaska, Torres del Paine and colourful markets in amazing places like Fa Long in Vietnam, Jaisalmer in India, & La Paz in Bolivia). I also love short domestic trips for weekends away just to relax. It means I get to be on the other side of the counter, and experience how other people look after their guests: and I take their good ideas back with me. 

(My manager, Max, has also travelled from afar to be here btw, and he can also speak with our guests in Russian and Ukranian).

I even worked as a part-time tourist guide in Melbourne for a couple of years, and really enjoyed the interactions with the tourists off the huge cruise liners that appear in Melbourne each spring and summer. I have tried to extend this experience into my accommodation business here at home, where I really love assisting people with their stays. You only need to read the 550 or so reviews on Airbnb, Trip advisor, Goo gle, and on my own StayCentral website to realise how much our guests enjoy our apartments, and the way we look after them. 

I like keeping fit with gym work and roller-blading; often blading 30 kms or so on a day out. I cook for my mates once a month, and have done so since 2007. I cook and they bring the wine; my other love since coming to Melbourne in 2003.

I love living in Melbourne. It enjoys a unique place in Australia. It is often described as the cultural, business, shopping and sporting capital of the country. The restaurants and cafes in Melbourne are amongst the best in the world. I love living in an urban village amongst these, and all the other everyday shops; and jumping on a tram and avoiding the hassles of traffic. It is a city of great opportunity, experiences, events and lifestyle that can be enjoyed by locals and visitors alike; and I really enjoy facilitating our guests' stays here.

StayCentral Melbourne Corporate Apartments is a unique group of serviced apartments in central Melbourne. We offer boutique short and long-stay accommodation for relocations, family holidays and getaways. Our comfortable apartments have also been enjoyed by employees and contractors, executives and people needing temporary accommodation. We even have many pet-friendly apartments available! We provide excellent customer service from the time you first contact us to make a booking, through to the end of your stay.

All of our properties from one-bedroom apartments to seven-bedroom mansions are close to all the everyday things our guests would need during their stay; from cafes, restaurants and supermarkets, to shops, trams and nightlife - yet all locations are generally very quiet.

All of our interiors have been designed by experienced interior designers, and you will experience that feeling of "I'm home!" when you walk in, make yourself a cuppa and put your feet up. We supply far more than tea and coffee etc. There are many extras that make your stay more pleasant for our guests; including shopping trolleys, free Netflix in most properties, umbrellas and book exchanges.

I do hope I have the opportunity to help you get to know Melbourne and grow to love it as I have.

Set in a brand new high rise apartment building, the property features an open plan living area, fully-equipped kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom and a balcony. This is the perfect place to call home during your time in Melbourne.  Perfect for families, couples and business visitors - all are welcome!

The apartment is clean, loungy, and beachy, giving you that holiday feel, yet quiet and the right distance from the bar areas of Fitzroy St.  So many great attractions surround the flat. While one guest staying is preferred, I am open to a couple if you look after the place. At the moment, I am also looking out for someone to stay longer term between July and November 2017.  For the beach boho vibe yet totally accessible, if you want the best position in Marvellous Melbourne. Generally, priority is for longer term stays but let's talk !
host_about:
I am an entertainment lawyer, singer and songwriter who loves the beach, the sun, and meeting new people from around the country and overseas.

I'm a big fan of Brazil, love Melbourne's food and arts, and always have an open mind when traveling and meeting new guests.

I'm pretty neat for a guy, and big on keeping the apartment really clean for any new guests.  Will help any new guests out with anything they need.
It's a laid back apartment, and a great place to relax after being out and about all day.

Adam

:)

Located in a quiet and leafy side street you will experience the best of both worlds.
space: This brand new, well-equipped ground floor apartment is well located within close reach of the Hospital Precinct, trendy Errol Street, Arden Street shops, Queen Victoria Market and a short tram ride into the CBD. We offer easy living with a flowing floorplan, open plan living/dining/kitchen leading to a private bedroom and en-suite bathroom with laundry facilities. host_about:
We've lived in the south-eastern suburbs of Melbourne for the last 6 plus years, experiencing the charms of other parts of Victoria before that.
We love property, travel, family and doing things with people we care about! Now we can combine our passions by hosting beautiful properties and sharing them with you and others so you too can enjoy the experience.  
Our focus is to provide value for money and a great experience for our guests in the most liveable city in the world!
Our properties have been carefully selected to be centrally located for all the wonders and activities the city provides, whether it be sport, theatre, shopping, business or any of the other multitudes of activities the city has to offer, we'd love to have you stay with us.

space: The room is simple - with a double bed and a wardrobe...but there is no natural light. There is a second bedroom in the apartment (that has a full length window and nice view) for those who wish to upgrade to a better room. See my listing "Room with a View" for availability and prices.
host_about:
Australian guy with an insatiable appetite for travel and all the great things that come with it...learning about cultural differences, discovering music, tasting new dishes (& learning to cook them!), broadening the mind, learning new languages, hours spent on buses, trains & planes to reflect, making new friends...there's so much to love about this lifestyle!

I am fortunate enough to own my own business and have a job that enables me to work and travel at the same (Website hidden by Airbnb) I make the most of it!  I've visited probably around 70-80 countries but still feel as though I have barely touched the surface!  

I relatively recently realised how great AirBnB is as a way of travelling other than staying in hotels and hostels.  Up until now I have had a few wonderful experiences being a guest in somebody's home...and, now, I have my own home which I am looking forward to opening the doors to others!

summary: An ENTIRE 2-BEDROOM apartment unit ALL TO YOURSELF right in the heart of Melbourne city and only a stone's throw away from Melbourne Central station. Fully furnished with FREE WiFi and a beautiful view of the city! BOOK NOW and receive 15% OFF car rentals with Europcar across Australia, New Zealand & UK wide along with 10% OFF any food and beverages at Andrew's Hamburgers on Franklin St!
space: Spacious for 1, roomy for 2, ideal for 3, accommodates a maximum of 4. A beautiful, centrally located inner-city abode laced with timber flooring and a modern architectural facade. This magnificent self-contained 2-BEDROOM apartment unit houses a master bedroom with a queen sized bed. A second bedroom with a queen sized bed. A warm and cozy bathroom. A spacious living area with a 2-seater couch. A fully decked kitchen and dining. Complimentary coffee and tea. A laundry area with a washer, dryer, iron and an ironing board. A private balcony. ALL TO YOURSELF! Wake up every morning to a delightful view of the CBD! Please click on the photos to view more about this property and it's surroundings. This fully equipped and furnished 55sqm home is ready to go with: - 32 inch LCD TV - Air Conditioning & heating - Wireless internet MASTER BEDROOM - Roller blinds for all windows - Queen sized bed - Quilt, pillows, sheets, throws & covers - Bedside table & lamp - Full length mirrors - Storage clos

summary: This smart, self-contained apartment is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family.

The apartment comes with security parking with lift access and the building has a security entrance.  It is located in a new designer complex close to, yet away from, the hustle and bustle of Brighton’s iconic Bay St and some of Brighton’s best loved café’s, restaurants and bars.

name: Cosy, comfortable and the height of convenience!
summary: Quiet, bright, cosy and convenient. Less than 5 minutes walk to the train (200m), shops, restaurants and all the conveniences you might need including supermarkets, banks and doctors - just literally up the road! Close to the city, with frequent trains getting you there in no more than 15 minutes. Moonee Ponds is also well-connected with tram and bus routes. It's a hidden gem of a neighbourhood with lovely streets and period houses. Also convenient for the races at Moonee Ponds and Flemington.
space: A cosy, bright, quiet space, with a double-bed, desk, and ample wardrobe space. One the first floor, at the back of the house, so it's nice and quiet. Tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Well-stocked bookshelf. Spacious bathroom, shared with the host or one person next bed roomThere's also an additional toilet downstairs.
host_about:
Hi I'm Linda. 

I've traveled widely to Europe including Switzerland (my favourite, such an amazing country!), France, Germany and Italy, the UK, West-Coast USA, and make regular trips to Thailand. 

My hobbies include meditation, yoga and dancing.

I enjoy meeting people and making friends with people from around the world!

name: Art House Warburton
summary: Creative, Clean and Spacious, a private one bedroom, ground floor studio apartment. Part of an Artist home, a Peaceful place of Inspiration, a place to relax, enjoy and spend some time. Surrounded by the majestic mountains of the beautiful Yarra Valley, nature walks and waterfalls. Close by is the picturesque River, next to a small village community with local crafts, shops and cafes. Many seasonal activities including walking, swimming, cycling, kayaking and snow play.
space: A spacious, private one bedroom ground floor studio.  Naturally cool in summer and warm in winter with double glazed windows and is well insulated, room has heater and fan. Private entrance and your own private bathroom with toilet and shower, modern fresh and stylish. Local made natural shampoo and soap, also towels, bedding and extra blankets provided. You have a kettle, microwave, toaster, bar fridge ,cups, bowls, plates, chopping board and cutlery. Enjoy a selection of tea and good coffee in my   beautiful surroundings, relaxing and listening to the magic of nature. Fresh local fruits and home grown veggies from the garden..depending on the season are for you to enjoy . Maps and notes provided, sharing local info on the best places to  eat ......see....go ...swim....explore ...  Check out can be flexible .... Always Happy to share my time and knowledge of my journey as an owner builder . THANK YOU
host_about:
It is through my art that the heart is expressed and
 manifested in an outward visual form to be shared with the
 people and the world around me. Expressing and sharing
 all that is felt and experienced with in me and  allowing me
 to contribute  JOY, PASSION, LOVE, MAGIC and BEAUTY 
 TO THE WORLD and BEYOND.

 I believe it is through our  imaginal faculties that we will
 together CREATE HEAVEN ON EARTH .

 (Website hidden by Airbnb)

name: Stay with us in our St Kilda Artists Home
summary: Our bohemian artist's home is located 5 minutes from the beach, cafes, restaurants and public transport to the City (20 mins) and the airport (40 mins). As well as your large private bedroom with a comfy bed, our peaceful, relaxing private back garden and airy rumpus room offers you the opportunity to recover from your adventures in our precious part of the world. Your hosts can introduce you to the experience of St Kilda's vibrant living culture including art, live music, film and theatre.
space: Our space has a lot of history and character. From a stately Elizabethan home, to 'he died with a felafel in his hand meets living on dog food' to surviving as an artist in the now post-Fordist baby boomer led generation. If these walls could talk, they'd probably rain a verbal heritage plaster storm of stories, colourful and interesting. Wild and unimaginable. Full of people's lives. You'd never want to leave, as we don't. (Apparently there's a world war II bunker in the garden somewhere. We've not yet found that or the mythological lost tab in the freezer.) Our lemon and cumquat trees are over 30 years old and burst forth seasonally. Last year we (accidentally) grew a wheat crop on the lawn so we started thinking, hmmm a rice paddy for 2017? Maybe. Who knows what next will bring, but we hope you too will love visiting our creatively inspiring space as much as the possums, native and guest wildlife do. Update: Our newest resident is Ceasar (all hail!) a distinguished senior house feli
host_about:
I’m from Moreton Bay (QLD), via Essex and Oxford UK to my now home of St Kilda. 

I love summer, walking around finding things, meeting people, writing, reading. Making ideas into objects or occurrences. For all sorts of life experience driven reasons. 

I'm working on a lifelong study of the creative and the community. Seeking signs of life, out there, of real people and their stories. Finding ways to ingest hope, opportunity, respect and a sense of the true value of places to individuals and to the broader society. Finding ways to create micro moments that might just spark life, into beautiful people whose flames can become embers when their tread gets loaded and weary. 

oh and of course I love music, especially the wonderfully inspiring people and artists that can be found around my home here in St Kilda. I'm 2 years (and counting) into an 'art-change'. If you can imagine, its a sea-change, where one leaves a perfectly good reliable career to take long observy walks, undertake immersive excursions and pour late into the nights hell bent on some particular creation. Fuelled by rum, smokes, good food and chocolate.

name: Eltham Treehouse
summary: Just a 10 minute walk to the Eltham town centre this first level apartment is in a great location to explore the surrounding area. Walk to Edendale Farm, along the Yarra River or relax in one of the many parks and cafés. This apartment is modern on the outside with a rustic and recycled interior. Light  a fire and enjoy being surrounded in an abundance of plants, tree views and sitting in one of the many quirky spaces.
space: Unknown
host_about: Unknown

name: Prahran 2 bedroom spacious apartment with car park
summary: Homely 2 bedroom apartment located in the inner suburbs of Melbourne. Illuminated with natural light, this second floor apartment is conveniently close to Chapel and High Street, Prahran Market, Hawksburn Village, public transport and our favorite cafes.  - Newly renovated kitchen. - Air condition available  - Wifi and Netflix provided.
space: The space: This is a spacious 2-bedroom apartment located in a walk up building on the second floor Our apartment is very accessible to a wide variety of entertainment options for all ages including: - 50 metres to the High Street tram stop that can take you to Chapel Street in a matter of minutes, or continue on to the CBD via St Kilda Road. - 100 metres to a BP petrol/service station. - 15 - 20 minute walk to the Prahran Market (Open Tues, Thurs, Fri, Sat & Sun) where you can purchase delicious fresh produce to bring back to the apartment.  - 50 metres to a great coffee cafe located on High Street opposite our street. We like to get a take away coffee and pastry from Teaspoon and bring it back to the balcony. - 5 minute walk to a pharmacy ( open until midnight) - 10 minute walk to our local supermarket (Woolworths) located in Hawskburn Village. Hawksburn Village is a great little strip of cafes, restaurants and boutique shops. - 5 minute tram ride to High street Armadale for some sho

There is also more restaurants and cafes around. You’ll love my place because of the neighbourhood, the ambiance, and the outdoors space. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. Late checkout at 12 pm (noon).
space: Lovely small space with ample cupboard space for storage. The place is quiet and clean, with a car park available. 2 minutes walk to the Ormond train station and 20 minute train ride to the CBD. You can also catch a bus to Chadstone shopping centre. Bus stop is 1 minute walk from my place.
host_about: Hi all, I'm a single dad. My ex and I share custody of our two sons, 2 and 3-year-old.

It is across from Etihad Stadium and you can see the full screen for sports matches,concerts,events & more it's good for couples,solo adventurers,business travellers & families, to enjoy the views, location, people & ambiance This 2 bedroom with 2 Bathroom apartment is on the Sub- Penthouse floor with amazing views from every room of the Bay, City, Mountains, Docklands, Port Melbourne, St,Kilda & more
host_about:
Hi, I am Deb.

I'm a semi-driver with a syd-melb run 6 days a week.
Although I do enjoy the finer things life has to offer, I have  always appreciated a casual, easy going outlook on life. Always first to make fun of myself and keen to have a laugh. 
 An avid traveller that really revels in making the most of every moment!!

I hope to catch you at my Sydney or Melbourne apartments. As I'm residing and working between both cities, I can easily organise myself to check you in personally and perhaps after learning a bit about ur stay, I may have some savvy suggestions. 

Otherwise, Have a Helluva Happy time Hunting.... Syd/melb have so much to offer. 
:)

name: BOUTIQUE STAYS - Sandy Breeze 1, 200m to beach
summary: Professionally managed by Boutique Stays, this lovely home has been furnished with a modern, contemporary style, and is highlighted by a large private front garden, where you can easily spend long summer evenings under the gazebo or otherwise across the road at the beach.
space: •	FREE UNLIMITED WIFI •	FREE Foxtel / Pay TV •	FREE Parking (for multiple on street) •	FREE Welcome Pack •	FREE Departure clean •	FREE Porta Cot The main living area features French doors opening out to the front garden, polished floorboards, an ornamental fireplace and comfortable seating for 6. Modern kitchen facilities include dishwasher, gas cook-top, electric oven, microwave and fridge/freezer with an island bench/breakfast bar. The dining and kitchen space overlooks the side courtyard with alfresco dining complete with BBQ and outdoor setting for 6. It is securely fenced which makes it perfect for pet guests as well The master bedroom features a King size bed, a sparkling new ensuite with shower, single vanity and toilet. The second bedroom features a Queen size bed, and the third has 2 single beds or can be converted to 1 king bed if required. All three bedrooms are carpeted and have built-in robes. The central bathroom has a shower with separate bath, single vanity and toilet.
host_about:
Founded in 2006, the Boutique Stays Accommodation Group is an accredited tourism business providing quality houses and apartments to singles, couples and families in Melbourne. Distinguished by a commitment to high property standards, impeccable presentation and personalised customer care provided by a team located in the bayside suburb of Port Melbourne. 

A bespoke collection of 60 homes in Melbourne’s most iconic and popular neighbourhoods are handpicked to make guests feel at home with peace of mind that a dedicated, professional customer service team are ready to support each and every guest seven days per week.  A range of one, two, three and four bedroom homes are available in a choice of twenty suburbs in Melbourne for guests visiting family and friends, holiday makers travelling with or without pets and business travellers.

The Boutique Stays Accommodation Group has welcomed over 4,000 guests and 150 pets into our homes in the past year and look forward to welcoming you for your first or return visit.

name: Cosy, artist cottage in exceptional location
summary: North Fitzroy in the most Melbourne part of Melbourne and the best suburb in Australia... in my unbiased opinion. Our house is located just down the road from dozens of bars and restaurants, the supermarket and the amazing Edinburgh Gardens. A little further down the road, you will find the iconic Brunswick street where you are truly spoilt for choice: incredible music venues, street art, galleries, bars and cafes.    Our house is typical of the area. Old but clean. Quirky and cute.
space: The house is a modest, double brick miners cottage.  It is definitely old - particularly the bathroom- but we keep the place clean and it is bursting with character and quirks. It is made up of 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom/laundry (with washing machine) and an open plan kitchen/dining/lounge space which backs onto a leafy courtyard and typical inner north, bluestone laneway. We have a projector installed in the lounge as well as a very decent sound set up for music/movies. Your room has a double bed, bedside lamp, work desk, a heater for the winter, a fan for the summer, a window that looks out on our makeshift shed area and outdoor storage, a wardrobe with hanging space, bookshelves filled to the brim and original art pieces on the walls.  You share the house with myself and my girlfriend as well as Alfred the cat. Alf is extremely sociable and will probably try to camp out in your room. I usually have some antihistamines around the house if our furry housemate makes your allergies flare.
host_about:
Hiya :)
I'm an actor and a visual artist based in Melbourne. I have just this year gone back to study at uni and when I am not there, I work out of my studio and at home. I enjoy getting together with pals, having picnics in the gardens and going to shows, gigs, local galleries and movies.  

I love hosting on air bnb cos meeting new people from all over the place helps me to feel like I'm travelling too :) I keep to myself mostly but am more than happy to have a drink and a chat and share a meal if you're keen- otherwise I'm just as happy to leave you to your own devices- whatever you like, it's your holiday. If this sounds good to you, you're more than welcome to come hang out with me, my girlfriend and my cat at our place in Fitzroy North :)

name: Nelson Room in B&B
summary: Unknown
space: * Upstairs * Aspect – onto laneway. * No spa, small bathroom * 32 inch digital TV & DVD player * Points of difference: Private hallway. TV with desk * 2 Full windows + 2 lead-light arched windows.
host_about:
Hosting people in our lovely old B&B home is what I do. With a lovely team of helpers, we run the award winning Captains Retreat B&B as well as numerous apartments and cottages here in beautiful, historic, waterside Williamstown.  

Interests: Art, Music, Sport, Travel, Movies, Good Food, Good Wine, Good Company and not last by any means Animals, in particular Cats. (note though that Simba and Leo (my so called Lions) are not allowed int the guest part of the house). 

Our lovely old home is just one door from the water, marina and restaurants and has been tastefully renovated so that every room has ensuites (some with spas) and half of the rooms also have gas log fires. One of the rooms has its own private lounge and balcony but other guests can enjoy their choice of two shared lounge rooms as well as a large north facing balcony and delightful private walled garden. 

Other than beds (which are new and very comfortable!!),  I love to buy antique and pre-loved furniture and  have them restored using classic and sometimes quirky fabrics. 

I'm proud to say that we have won numerous awards including 'tourism' and 'hospitality' at the Hobsons Bay region Business excellence awards (3 times) as well as taken out the People's Choice award for the state of Victoria twice in the last three awards. 

Most of our guests are business people or travellers so you can be assured of a quiet, relaxing and private 'home award from home' experience. 
We look forward to welcoming you Williamstown.  
- Melissa

name: Family Friendly Character Apartment-Top City Views
summary: A supreme location in a heritage listed building will see you living like a Melbourne local in style and comfort.  My renovated 2-bedroom home is packed with character, and has two balconies from which to enjoy the sublime city views; and a special turret room with a queen sized bed and study nook. Errol Street’s vibrant retail, hospitality and arts precinct is just a short stroll away, and lots of fun to explore, while the CBD is also within walking distance or a quick train trip away.
space: My apartment is located in vibrant North Melbourne, situated within the revitalised, landmark circa 1929 Mulcahy’s Hotel building. The interior is fully renovated, so you can enjoy modern living in this family-friendly and light-filled space.   The apartment features high ceilings, bespoke cabinetry, and two balconies from which to enjoy a great Melbourne outlook– one terrace offering views of the city’s tallest buildings which create a really special backdrop; and from the other balcony you can see local industrial landmarks.  The open plan living area is cosy and comfortable. There is a high speed internet service with full wifi accessibility, while a flat screen TV is available as well. Have nights in, curled up on the comfy couch with a movie on the TV - that’s if you’re not too busy making the most out of all the fabulous nearby restaurants, cafes, bars and pubs. The kitchen is fully equipped with all mod cons including a large fridge, oven, cooktop, a Sodastream machine, a toaste

name: Nice and big, upstairs room for two people
summary: The room has double glazed windows and free internet and a good view of the street outside. The room has a large bed. A table. Apple TV 4. A chair and dressing table. You share with two other rooms. The only common spaces are the kitchen and the bathroom and outside. There is no lounge room. Please also note  that although we clean daily the rating from previous guests for cleanliness at 4.6 stars. Also at times the internet is slower than people would like, due to peak time usage.
space: The house has shared facilities including internet and is four minutes walk to numerous shopping and food options, hospital and entertainment/sporting venues

I have recently visited China on a Nexus tour which was great. But my favourite destination is Tokyo, Japan

We are both working professionals We can also provide dinner at an additional cost We are very flexible with early check in and late check out depending upon the next booking
space: Unknown
host_about: We are easy going people and like to have a good chat with people at the same time always happy to give them their space.

name: Warehouse loft Fitzroy/Collingwood
summary: This 2 bedroom warehouse loft in Collingwood/Fitzroy is perfectly located, just around the corner from Smith & Brunswick streets' cool cafe, bar & restaurant scene.
space: Perfectly located 2-bedroom loft in the heart of Collingwood's historic Foy & Gibson warehouse precinct. This apartment is on two levels and offers an open living/kitchen zone, a big loft style bedroom (with a curtain for privacy), a closed second bedroom, a bathroom with a large shower and a separate laundry. Featuring high ceilings, outdoor area, skylights and hardwood floors. There are heaters on both floors to keep you warm during the winter and AC for the summer.
host_about: I'm a travel journalist living in Melbourne, Australia. I'm originally from Montréal, Canada. I speak French and English. I love cinema, travel and sausage dogs.

name: Friendly Fabulous Brunswick - Private Studio Room
summary: Our newly renovated house with minimalist decor is the perfect base to explore the city. Only 3 minutes walk from Jewell Station, you can be in the CBD within 20 minutes (or 15 minutes by bike), or take a short stroll to Sydney Rd to check out all the wonderful cafes and shops in this popular strip. Clean, comfortable and with plenty of undercover outdoor spaces, it's also the ideal location to ride out those rainy days.
space: Just minutes from Sydney Rd, in the city (south) end of Brunswick, sits our newly renovated 3 bedroom + studio 50's brick house. North facing windows welcome plenty of natural light, perfect for relaxing in the large living room. Food lovers will adore the massive kitchen, equipped with all the utensils you could need, along with a range of spices and condiments at your disposal.
host_about:
Hello there! My bestie Luke and I live in a lovely renovated 1950s house just off Sydney Road. We both enjoy bikes, vegetables, circus, music, theatre, silliness and laughing. Luke works in IT and seems to be able to work out anything technical, sometimes in a MacGyver kind of way. I work in a playground and have a bit of a thing for physical games (think skipping, poison ball - that kind of thing).

Between the two of us, we have done a bit of travelling, locations including NZ, Vanuatu, New Caledonia, Denmark, Germany, UK, Netherlands, Poland, Czech Republic, Norway, Belgium (for 2 hours), USA, Canada, Argentina and bits of Australia of course. We've both enjoyed variety within our travels - mixing camping and staying on couches with 5 star hotels (and everything in between); hitch-hiking and bike touring with river cruises and helicopter trips; dumpster diving and fine dining. It's all good. But the most memorable and special parts of a trip are the friendships you make.

name: Comfy stay at the heart of Melbourne CBD
summary: Located at the heart of Melbourne CBD, the apartment will definitely make your stay comfortable and convenient in every aspect. Very close to tram stops, train station and bus stops with only 3~5 minutes walking distance. Some iconic Melbourne tourist places nearby include the Queen Victoria Market, RMIT University, Melbourne Central Station.
space: The apartment is located on the 14th floor with an open balcony to enjoy the city view. Facilities available for use are Main Lounge Area, Swimming Pool, Sauna and BBQ Area.
host_about: Unknown

name: Friendly, comfortable cityhome base
summary: Ideally located close to Melbourne city, the excitement of  live music, eclectic shopping, galleries, street art, cafes and clubs of Smith Street and Brunswick Street are all strolling distance, making this a perfect home-base for exploring the town.
space: My freestanding house is only 2.6 km from the city.The front guest bedroom has a comfortable queen size bed, fresh linen, ample built in cupboard space and a Victorian terrace balcony at the entrance of the house where you can sit, read the paper and watch the world go by. Two doors down is a local park, a haven for city dwellers who like to sprawl on the grass and catch some sun rays, play on the swings, or practice the saxophone. A 5 minute walk in any direction will take you to cafes and pubs. CIBI offers a delicious Japanese breakfast all day and you can browse the exquisite collection of Japanese Artisan products. The Knife shop is a homely 50's style cafe with live music on the weekends. The Gem Hotel is a favourite with the locals for a meal, live music and DJ's.
host_about:
I am an artist and educator passionate about arts. I teach part-time, develop and write education resources, support arts organisations working with broader communities and connect with others to develop creative projects.  I am a friendly, open person interested in people, community, travel, social and spiritual development. I'm mostly a vegetarian who enjoys growing, cooking and eating organic produce.
I have lived and worked in remote Indigenous communities throughout Australia and have thoroughly enjoyed my travels in South and North India, Nepal, parts of Europe and Beautiful New Zealand. I am a flexible host, happy to meet you and offer any local advice you may need. I appreciate the different needs and interests of visitors and as a guest, I am respectful of personal space and also very happy to engage conversation.

name: Garden view room for lease
summary: Room for lease Melbourne East District, Viewbank  ⭕Room type: double room, 2 single beds ⭕Rent: Long-term(1 month) rent     $120 / person / week; (Website hidden by Airbnb) Short-term (1-3 week) rent  $ 130 / person / week (Website hidden by Airbnb) *If not enough 1 week $30/person/day ⭕Share bathroom, toilet, living room and kitchen !! ️ Deposit for one week, pay together with the rent on the day of check-in!! ️ !! ️Return deposit conditions: no damage any items, key return!! ️ ❌No smoking❌
space: Unknown
host_about: Unknown

name: Flemington,secure & central. Walk to train&races
summary: Lovely secure brick house, walking to the Flemington races, showgrounds, train, tram, shops, restaurants and bars. Very close to the city.  Lovely outdoor area with BBQ and fire pit.  You'll have your own room close to the front door and at times you'll have the whole place to yourself when we're away.  Message us for details.  We are very flexible and will do the best to accommodate. TV with Netflix and stan is in your room.  The bed is very comfortable.
space: Spa bath in bathroom.
host_about: Unknown

name: Stylish Albert Park Studio with French Influences
summary: Open the shutters and enjoy breakfast on the private balcony, then hop on a tram to Albert Park Beach or step out for a day of shopping. Get dressed up for a luxurious dinner at Ricardo's, or take a romantic moonlit stroll through St Vincent Gardens.
space: Proximity to city (6 min drive) or a short tram ride - the tram passes straight by the studio, with the stop being a 30 sec walk away.  You are literally a stone's throw from the Albert Park Village - either formal and hip dining or a take away from Andrew's or Salt Water Grill or even a ready made meal and a bottle of vino from Gum Tree - all less than 100m away.  Too lazy to walk.... just call Uber Eats or Deliveroo and they will have a meal to you in moments. In terms of the unit - smallest attention to detail in terms of the bedding and French cutlery, toiletries, rugs for the balcony and even towels for the beach - we have aimed to think of everything to make your stay memorable.....we even provide a light continental breakfast for your first morning stay. The studio offers a kitchenette and small bathroom, both extremely clean and functional.
host_about:
I love creating beautiful spaces in wonderful environments.  Albert Park Village is one such place where you can find me with my baby girl, Milly the mini schnauzer.  With 51 West I have tried to create a cosy home away from home. Whilst compact, I have focussed on the finer details like quality linen, goose down doona, and other things that touch the senses.  I hope you enjoy what I have created.
In terms of hosting, I believe in a light touch - meaning, I will introduce myself, but leave it to you to enjoy your break - but of course as long time Melbournians, my partner and I are always available to provide suggestions and recommendations.

name: Simple 2BR Stay Near Queen Vic Market + Free WiFi
summary: Comfy two-bedroom apartment located near Queen Victoria Market, Flagstaff Garden and Elizabeth St food district. This apartment provides all the basics you need for your Melbourne stay, from toiletries to WiFi! Come and enjoy Melbourne at our place, chat with us and we will be more than happy to share with you some local tips too.
space: Great apartment located in Melbourne's market end, with Queen Victoria Market, Flagstaff Garden and Elizabeth St food district just around the corner. It's an amazing place for anyone looking to enjoy few days in Melbourne and to savour a true Melbourne lifestyle.
host_about:
My family moved to Melbourne around 15 years ago and we feel blessed by every bits and alleys of this gorgeous city.

About me - I am an IT graduate from RMIT University Melbourne and worked in tech company for last few years. Now, I'm running accommodation business with my brother. We are hosting a number of apartments around Melbourne CBD and ensure the rooms are guest-ready all the time.

Aside from working, we love travel and enjoy great coffee, so you bet we can recommend you some of iconic Melbourne brunch places and cafes that definitely make your stay in Melbourne memorable.

name: CBD/CityView/HighLevel /WIFI/EM23905
summary: Empire located the central of CBD is the complete package! RMIT, Victoria and Melbourne Universities are all within easy walking distance. An enormous variety of great shopping is at your feet – from the fabulous fresh produce of Queen Victoria Market to major department stores at Melbourne Central, as well as an amazing range of specialty outlets all around. With terrific nightlife and entertainment options on every corner, there’s always something to do in your spare time.
space: Living area: - Light filled open plan main living area with outdoor balcony  - TV - Fully equipped kitchen - Washer & Dryer Bedroom:  - Bedroom with Queen-sized bed, all linens provided - Essentials: Quilt, pillows, sheets, throws & cushions Bathroom - Toilet rolls, Hair dryer - Towels, shampoo, Shampoos, conditioner, body gel and lotion KITCHEN APPLIANCES - Oven, Microwave, Range hood, Cooktop, Toaster - Fridge & Freezer  - Dishwasher & Detergents  - Kettle, Mugs, Cups, Wine glasses & Dishes - Pots, Pans, Cutlery & Cooking Utensils, Tableware. ★FREE wireless internet & laptop friendly workspace
host_about: Unknown

name: The Domain Precinct Apartment with Stunning Views
summary: Sip a morning coffee out on the private balcony overlooking the cityscape. Relax in a bright open-concept living space featuring rustic and mid-century furnishings, artful touches of colour, and a covered street-facing front porch.
space: This spacious and luxurious solid brick single bedroom apartment features both front and rear balconies - the large rear balcony opens from french doors through the bedroom and features city skyline views, while the front balcony offers stunning views of some Melbourne’s most impressive Victorian terrace houses. Inside the apartment is decorated in a combination of mid-century and modern styles featuring a Mark Tuckey bed, quality mattress / linen, 60's Danish armchairs and numerous high-quality furnishings. Other features include a meals & work area, heating / cooling, an up-market European laundry & black granite kitchen, a large smart TV with Netflix, Sony bluetooth speaker, unlimited WiFi and a host of other conveniences designed to make your visit to Melbourne one to remember. A parking permit is available for easy parking outside the building.
host_about: I'm a creative director with my own business based in Melbourne. I have a passion for travel and the wonderful city I live in. I've enjoyed staying in many wonderful Airbnb's in my travels and that's the inspiration for me to host my own. I take pride in offering my apartment to guests and I enjoy meeting new people from around the globe.

name: Lyrebird Retreat
summary: An intimate heritage style retreat for two, with wrought iron queen bed fitted with gorgeous ivory bed linen, log fire and oval spa bath.
space: The perfect romantic hideaway… Still part of the history of one of the original guest houses of the early 1920’s, the private verandah looks out upon lush gardens, Japanese Maple and Liquid Amber trees… A view to behold. As you enter Lyrebird Retreat you have a sense of being part of a very romantic era. The open living space offers a cosy ambience with it’s antique French log wood fire making it a perfect setting for lounging around on the comfy sofa and armchair. Enjoy the ambient flames while dining by candlelight. The petite fully equipped kitchen is perfect for cooking that special breakfast to serve alfresco on the verandah. Walking through quaint French doors to the bedroom area, the elegant décor continues… Ivory damask, burgundy contrast, the detail and flavour of the past. The oval couples spa is central to the bedroom, and is set next to the enticing bed, so the rest is left to your imagination. The en suite offers separate shower and all the usual mod cons.
host_about: Always available to help.

summary: Nested in t one of the coolest developments in Collingwood, this awesome townhouse retweet is only a block away from the funkiest cafes, bars and restaurants Collingwood has to offer. Book ahead to avoid disappointment.
space: Ground level, quiet, 2 stories.
host_about: I'm in the Project Marketing Real Estate business. Part of our core business is to help manage rental properties for our clients. One of my hobbies is to fit-out homes that are creative and inviting for our guest to enjoy and meet people all over the world. I have an eye for details, likes drinking coffee, taking photos for fun, love everything fast and would like to spend more time traveling. Hope to meet you soon.

name: St Kilda/Elwood Waterviews WoyWoy 2
summary: Located on the ground floor of the iconic modernist Woy Woy building on Marine Parade in Elwood, this apartment is perfect for those looking for more than a hotel room. Views across the bay are ever changing. Enjoy the close proximity to St Kilda's Acland Street & Elwood's vibrant Ormond Road Village. Close to city transport WoyWoy 2 is the perfect base for holiday visitors or business travellers looking for a lifestyle location and not a box in the city. Stay here and live like a local.
space: Couples can stay. Or friends can stay. The sleeping arrangements are two King Singles, pushed together or separated. Your choice. The apartment is not large but plenty of room for two. Light-filled lounge room with Smart TV, plenty of books and divine 1950's Italia armchair and leather couch. Separate dining table and chairs for two. Kitchen is equipped with gas cook top and oven, stovetop coffee maker (and coffee), bar fridge and all the cookware and dinnerware you'll need.
host_about: Long time resident of St Kilda/Elwood area. Formerly of Western Australia. Owner and operator of 7 award winning self contained holiday apartments on the Mornington Peninsula (Aquabelle) as well as Woy Woy. I live to provide lovely, self contained accommodation for family and friends to share special times together in  lovely locations.

Less than 10 mins walk, you will get to Box Hill Centro with hundreds of restaurants, large supermarkets, countless Asian grocery store, Box Hill Railway Station and Box Hill Bus interchange. The apartment itself is tastefully furnished with high end furniture which brings you the best comfort. The fully equipped kitchen allows you to cook delicious meals just like at your home.  Free underground parking.
space: This fully equipped and furnished 2 bedroom apartment is ready to go with: - 50 inches LED TV - Reverse cycle airconditioning BEDROOM AREAS - Roller blinds for all windows - Quilt, pillows, sheets & covers - Bedside table & lamp - Wardrobe - Hangers BATHROOM - Shampoo, body wash & hand soap - Bath & hand towels - Floor Mats - Toilet rolls - Hair dryer LIVING ROOM - Roller blinds for all windows - Marble coffee table - Comfy 3-seater sofa with arm chair Dining AREA - Dining table & chairs KITCHEN AREA - Complimentary coffee & tea - Oven, microwave, cooktop & rangehood - Fridge with freezer - Dishwasher & detergents - Kettle, mugs, cups, wine glasses & dishes - Pots, pans, cutlery & cooking utensils - Kitchen towels & bin LAUNDRY AREA - Washing machine & detergents
host_about: Unknown

name: NAPIER: Bright Fitzroy Apartment
summary: Enjoy this newly renovated, light-filled apartment in Melbourne's best neighbourhood. Just metres from Gertrude St cafes and bars, and a short walk to Brunswick and Smith Streets. Please check out the HOUSE RULES section before sending inquiry. Many Frequently Asked Questions are answered there.
space: Our bright Fitzroy apartment was lovingly renovated by us and was our home for a few months before our baby arrived. The simple and clean space has everything you can possibly need, and good design means there is tons of storage in a small space. We offer a comfy queen bed topped with hotel quality linen, professionally cleaned after each stay. There's also a modern fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher and cosy eating corner, and a renovated bathroom.  We provide tea, all the kitchen essentials, fresh linen and towels, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, Myki cards for use on public transport, a mini library and a local guide.
host_about: I am an artist and renovator who loves creating beautiful spaces. I've travelled the world and have now temporarily settled in Abbotsford with my partner and new baby.

name: Tidy and Comfy Private Bedroom Melbs CBD
summary: Super clean, well organized and a friendly place to stay definitely! we´ve tried our best to keep this apartment as well-equipped and amazing as you can see in the pictures!
space: Carpet all over the place, full equipped kitchen, netflix and excellent wifi connection, you can enjoy of the best view from the balcony and window´s room and we will be happy to take care of every single guest at our lovely apartment! Whether it is your first time in melbourne we will make sure that you enjoy the best and the most important venues in and out the city! we do not allow smokers and pets neither unfortunately! and there is a swiming pool to enjoy while staying at our premises! Will take you 15 minutes walk to the city center or just 5-7 minutes by public transport! do not worry about leaving your car outside because we´ve got ready with a private covered carpark for you! any further questions please do not hesitate to contact us!
host_about: Hello everyone! I’m Miguel, a Colombian lawyer currently residing in Australia. My mother tongue is the Spanish but I can also speak fluent English! I consider myself an easygoing person, very responsible, tidy and respectful! Every time I get to travel I try to make as many friends as I can so that’s life all about, meeting good people around the world.

name: Modern 2BR House
summary: Modern house with everything you need on your vacation to Melbourne, plus a little more. You’ll love my place because of the furnishings, the proximity and the comforts of a modern home. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids).
space: Unknown
host_about: I'm a creative type living in Bedford Stuyvesant in New York with my wife and two children. We live in  a three story brownstone that we rent out to friends and family when available. I'm originally from Kangaroo Ground in Melbourne, Australia, but have lived in Tasmania, Sydney, Colorado, Toronto, Oregon and have travelled extensively when I was younger. I'm into new technology, books, literature, food, community, business, fashion, art, culture and politics around the globe. My father was greek from Florina, I speak a little Greek, a little more French and virtually no Spanish. If you need any help whilst preparing for a trip to New York, please get in touch, I'm happy to help.

name: St Kilda Botanical Gardens
summary: Opposite St. Kilda Botanical Gardens. Large apartment in fabulous location.
space: All of apartment is for guests to use.
host_about: Married woman in my 50's,  with 3 adult children. Love live music, red wine, dancing and meeting new people. Favourite movie is Pretty Woman, interested in health and exercise, eating organically, and the environment.
